In a preferred form, each strap anchor is in the form of a channel with the strap being a snap lock that is releasably locked therein against displacement. The strap is snap-locked into the channel by snapping engagement beneath locking lips at an open side of the channel facing the base of the channel. Inter-engaging formations on the base of the channel and surface of the strap prevent longitudinal displacement of the strap within the channel when it's in its engaged position.

The strap enters into the channel via an aperture in the base of the channel, and a projection extends into the adjacent hole in the cover to ensure correct location between the strap anchor and the cover. The album has at least two fasteners mounted along the spine part of the album, with the strap anchors of each fastener being attached to the respective covers of the album.

The strap anchors can be adhesively attached to the respective covers, for example by double-sided adhesive tape. This design offers a more convenient and efficient method for adding or replacing album pages compared to traditional screw-type fasteners.

The present invention relates to methods and apparatus for removing a gas from a liquid, specifically for separating oxygen from water in offshore hydrocarbon recovery platforms. Current practices for removing oxygen from water include stripping towers and chemical scavengers, but these methods are not always efficient and can require excessive vessel heights. The invention describes an apparatus for removing a gas from a liquid that includes a vessel divided into multiple gasification chambers, each with a vapor space and a mechanism for ingesting and mixing a second gas into the liquid for displacing at least a portion of the first gas to the vapor space. A vent in each chamber allows for the removal of gas and a liquid outlet from the outlet chamber. The apparatus is particularly suited for use on floating offshore hydrocarbon recovery platforms and can reduce the height requirements and capital costs compared to separate stripping towers. The invention can also be used to displace other undesired gases from liquids.

This disclosure presents an improved packaging machine with a simpler, more compact design. The packaging machine has a rotationally driven shaft in the production direction, which drives the tool members of various work stations through at least one transfer mechanism. This synchronizes the movements of the tool members mechanically, reducing potential errors of electronic synchronization. The shaft requires little installation space, allowing for a compact structural design. The transfer mechanism can include an arrangement of toggle levers or a cam mechanism, with a wear-reducing element to reduce wear on the transfer mechanism and shaft. The shaft can be driven in a continuous 360° rotation or alternately in different directions for alternating tool-member lifting movements. Work stations of the packaging machine can include a forming station, sealing station, and/or separating or cutting station, with at least two work stations arranged on different vertical levels for a more compact structural design.

The source document describes a new rail car truck bowl liner made of a self-lubricating, conductive polymer. This liner eliminates the need for separate lubrication and grounding apparatus, as it provides both self-lubrication and conductivity. The liner is designed to fully fill the space between the truck bolster bowl and the body bolster center plate, and it is made of a high density polymer mixed with a conductive material such as carbon black. This liner is an improvement over previous all UHMW-PE liners, which have high resistance, and clip or shunt grounded versions, which have an inconsistent coefficient of friction.

This text describes a power and free conveyor system with a mechanism for transferring carriers from one predetermined path to another. The invention involves the use of a third dog that can be moved to an operative position to push the carrier across a transfer zone. This allows for selective transfer of the carrier over short or long distances, and can be accomplished with minimum cost and maintenance. The system includes a power chain with pushers that engage the carriers, and a track with cam projections that hold the dogs out of operative position. When the carrier moves to a transfer zone, one or the other of the second and third dogs is moved to an operative position to transfer the carrier. The text includes several figures to illustrate the various components and configurations of the system.

The source document describes a vehicular rearview mirror system with a mirror control that can determine the protocol of an output of a vehicle control, such as a reverse-gear indication. This allows the same mirror system to be used in vehicles with different output protocols. The mirror control can be a microcomputer with software that determines the protocol by monitoring the output of the vehicle control. The microcomputer can also establish a reflectance level of an electro-optic reflective element in response to a drive signal and control a lighting assembly associated with a rearview mirror system. The system includes electro-optic reflective elements, mirror control circuits, and mirror controllers in interior and exterior mirror assemblies.

The described invention is an improved partition system for dividing cargo spaces in transportation vehicles like trailers, railcars, and containers. This system allows for the creation of multiple cargo areas within the same space, each of which can be maintained at different temperatures. The system consists of at least two panels that can be moved independently, attached to one or more mounting assemblies, and slidably attached to rails in the ceiling of the vehicle. The panels can be moved in the fore and aft direction to define different cargo areas in cooperation with a removable center partition wall.

The invention describes a pallet system with a pallet cap that has guide rails for loading trays. The guide rails help position and interlock the trays, restricting their movement. End plates provide stability and can be shaped to complement the trays. The components can be made from various materials and manufactured using different methods. The design can be customized for specific loads, such as egg trays.

The source document describes an improved valve-tray assembly for gas-liquid contacting trays, which incorporates directional thrust valves and tray construction for higher efficiency operation. The invention aims to address the problem of restricted disengagement of vapor retained in the liquid in fractionation column trays. It also discusses various configurations, designs, and performance issues related to gas-liquid contact devices, such as tray valves and their orientation, and the impact of vapor-liquid flow problems on tray efficiency.

The text describes a novel sanitizable rotary valve used in conjunction with liquid chromatographic columns and sanitary liquid handling systems to separate and/or purify biological macromolecules. The valve is designed to allow for simulated moving bed counter-current operation and can be sanitized in place without disassembly. The valve has not been previously described in the prior art, and its invention is important for the process-scale manufacture of pharmaceuticals, where sanitizing means are mandatory to ensure removal of contamination within the wetted surfaces of the valve following use, without the need for disassembly.

The present invention relates to streptavidin muteins, a process for their production using recombinant DNA technology, and their use for the isolation, purification, and determination of biological substances. The muteins have a higher binding affinity for peptide ligands than wild-type streptavidin. The muteins can be derived from wild-type streptavidin or variants thereof, with modifications including substitutions, insertions, deletions, and N- or C-terminal additions. The muteins can be used in various methods, including affinity chromatography, ELISA, Western blot, and immune microscopy. The muteins can also be used in a nucleic acid construct with a signal peptide for expression in a host cell.

The present invention introduces a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure. This assembly reduces variances in output pressure due to large differences in input pressure, and is inexpensive to manufacture and maintain. It is also lightweight and portable, and reduces the size and cost of a regulator needed to regulate fluid pressure. The assembly comprises a pressurized fluid source, means for providing a pressurized fluid, first and second means for transporting a pressurized fluid, a fluid regulator, and means for converting a pressurized fluid into mechanical power. In a preferred embodiment, the converting means is a vane pump that converts pressurized fluid into movement of the vanes, which can then be converted into rotational and/or electrical energy. The assembly can be used in various applications, such as gas grills, diving gear, and vehicles driven by pressurized flammable fluids.

The invention describes methods for forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts and guanylating agents such as thioureas or isothioureas. The nickel catalysts, which are preferably in the zero oxidation state, can be derived from nickel-boride alloys, nickel-phosphide alloys, aluminum-nickel alloys, nickel on kieselguhr, and nickel on silica/alumina. These methods are advantageous because they use less reagents and produce fewer by-products compared to prior art methods.

<summary>

1. The invention describes a gate valve for controlling the bulk dispensing of viscous substances, especially in fast-food restaurants, where one-handed operation is desirable.
2. The valve is designed to fit on the spout of a bag or pouch containing substances like sauces, salad dressings, catsup, mustard, etc.
3. The prior art includes rotatable cylindrical tube type and ball-type valves, both of which have issues with residue accumulation and cannot be tilted for complete discharge.
4. The new valve is a gate valve that can be operated with one hand, leaving the other hand free to hold the receiving vessel.
5. The valve includes a tubular sleeve that fits into the spout of a bag, a dispensing passage extending through it, and a reciprocable gate carried by a guide.
6. The gate can be reciprocated by engaging cooperating lugs with the fingers, sealing the discharge outlet when closed and providing variable flow when moving towards the closed position.
7. The drawings illustrate the valve's design and operation, showing the valve mounted on the spout of a bag in a dispenser.
8. The valve comprises a spout insert mounting sleeve, a passage with a discharge outlet and an annular sealing edge, and an annular stop shoulder.
9. The gate valve member is guided by a transversely-curved plate formed integrally with the sleeve, and is reciprocated using an integral upward guide and operating channel-like extension.
10. The gate valve member can be readily disassembled for cleaning and reassembled, and functions effectively in inclined positions. </summary>

The invention describes a swash plate type compressor with a coated swash plate to reduce frictional wear and increase durability. The coating is made of a polyfluoro elastomer bonded directly to the aluminum swash plate, with lubricious and load bearing additives. The coating process does not require a high surface finish, and a roughened surface provides maximum adhesion. The coating provides smooth surfaces, potentially eliminating machining steps in the manufacturing process. The coating is durable, withstands high loads, and maintains low friction coefficients. The invention allows for the use of lower cost, non-hypereutectic aluminum alloys, and the coating process is an alternative to electroplating.

The present invention describes a process for producing transgenic plants or plant cells stably transformed on a chromosome with a DNA sequence of interest, using at least two different vectors that can recombine with each other by site-specific recombination in plant cells for producing a non-replicating recombination product containing the DNA sequence of interest. The process aims to achieve genetically stable transgenic plants or plant cells with reduced cloning work, the ability to screen for an optimal expression unit of a gene of interest, and the use of vectors in a modular fashion. The invention also provides a process for screening DNA libraries for desired functions in plants and an in planta process of shuffling genetic elements/gene fragments linked with stably transforming plants or plant cells with a DNA sequence of interest resulting from the shuffling.

The present invention is a method and apparatus for continuously electrolytically coloring aluminum strips or wires. The method involves a two-step process of first anodizing the aluminum in an acid bath, then electrolytically coloring the anodized surface in a separate bath containing a metal salt. The apparatus includes an anodic oxidation bath, an electrolytic coloring bath, and a power source that causes the aluminum to function as an anode in the anodic oxidation bath and as a cathode in the electrolytic coloring bath. The thickness of the oxide film formed in the anodic oxidation bath affects the color obtained in the electrolytic coloring bath. The apparatus can produce continuously and inexpensively aluminum strips or wires with colored oxide films that are superior in weatherability and fade resistance.

The invention describes a hydraulic unit for a vehicle brake system with an improved pressure fluid handling system. The hydraulic unit includes a housing block, a motor, a housing, and a covering hood. The motor is secured to the housing block and has a shaft connected to an eccentric, which is part of a cam element chamber. The system includes first conduit portions that extend downward from the cam element chamber and discharge into spring chambers. These conduit portions allow pressure fluid from the cam element chamber to flow into the spring chambers, preventing dirt and water from entering the bores from below. A generic pressure equalization conduit exists between the spring chambers and the interior of the motor, allowing air to escape when a piston moves counter to the force of its spring. A pressure equilibrium is created between the interior of the motor and the housing, which is sealed off relative to the housing block. This is achieved through a pressure equalization conduit formed by interstices between wires of a cable and a tubular cable sheath that sheathes the wires. The cable sheath is introduced into a further sealing sleeve, which is located inside a second plug part, and is connected at least indirectly to a connection cable in a way that equalizes pressure. The connection cable comprises a cable sheath and a plurality of sheathed connection strands. Contact elements are disposed in a sealed plug base located on the housing and the connection part in such a way that beginning at the connection strands, air flow possibilities are present, which can be from the cable sheath into the housing or in the opposite direction. The connection cable is extended upward inside the vehicle to the highest possible point, allowing the cable sheath to act as a pressure equalization conduit between the ambient atmosphere and the interior of the housing and indirectly for the motor as well. The provisions directly prevent the invasion of water to the hydraulic unit while providing a pressure equalization of interiors of the hydraulic unit with the ambient atmosphere and diverting pressure fluid, entrained by pump pistons, into a region of the unit that is located far from vulnerable electrical parts of the hydraulic unit.

The present invention describes methods and apparatus for inserting weft threads with varying thickness in a multiple-color air jet loom. The system varies the pressure and duration of air jets to provide a consistent carrying force for each weft thread, improving efficiency and preventing undue consumption of pressurized air.

<summary>

1. The invention describes an anti-lock braking system with an anti-dive device for motorcycles, which reduces chassis vibration caused by the rapid cycling of the brake on and off during anti-lock braking.
2. The anti-dive device is responsive to the brake force applied to the front wheel and can be achieved by tapping hydraulic pressure downstream of the anti-lock control unit or by sensing and applying the actual reaction to braking force of the front wheel.
3. The system includes a front wheel brake operated by a master cylinder through a brake line and an anti-lock control unit interposed in the brake line.
4. The anti-lock control unit senses the nearly-locked condition of the front wheel and shuts off the hydraulic pressure to the brake.
5. The problem of chassis vibration is particularly noticeable in motorcycles with high centers of gravity and short wheelbases.
6. The reaction of the front fork to braking and the anti-lock braking device is to begin to dive, which can slightly decrease braking efficiency during the short period when there is no increase in front wheel load.
7. The embodiment of the invention includes a motorcycle with left and right front wheel brakes, first and second rear wheel brakes, a front master cylinder, and a rear master cylinder.
8. The front wheel brakes are operated by an output hydraulic pressure from the front master cylinder, and the rear wheel brakes are operated by an output hydraulic pressure from the rear master cylinder.
9. The hydraulic braking pressure for the front wheel brakes is controlled by an anti-lock control unit, which is provided in a hydraulic pipe connecting the master cylinder and the brake calipers.
10. The anti-lock control unit consists of a hydraulic pump, a modulator, a pressure discharge valve, and an inertial sensor, which are arranged in a casing and supported on the axle and front fork.

</summary>

The present invention describes a process for spinning bast fibers, such as jute, kenaf, or hemp, which includes health-preserving the fibers in specific temperature, humidity, and duration conditions to improve flexibility and spinnability. This process can reduce the end breakage rate of yarn during spinning. The invention also includes blending health-preserved bast fibers with other fibers and spinning them into multi-fiber yarn. Examples of different bast fibers, blending proportions, health-preserving conditions, and resulting end breakage rates are provided.

The invention describes a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics, where the yarns in at least two of the layers are laid at an angle to the long axis of the fabric. These fabrics are held together by stitching through the layers or by other external means such as adhesive bonding. This invention provides a rake mechanism, synchronized with, but driven separately from, the conveyors, yarn carrying means, and bonding mechanism, to achieve greater assurance of parallelism of the yarns and better control of the strength and thickness of the resulting layer.

The invention describes a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from different fiber types. It measures the entire momentary quantity of a fiber lot prior to each pass of the bale opener and determines a certain partial quantity that corresponds to a predetermined proportion of the momentary entire quantity. This determined partial quantity is continuously removed only from the measured fiber lot. This process ensures that the opening of all fiber bales is effected without fiber residuals and further, that an optimally homogeneous mixture is obtained. The invention also sets a predetermined period for the removal of the individual quantity proportions to maintain a determined time schedule in the opening of the fiber bales and prevent idle run of after-connected processing machines.

The present invention provides an improved method for producing 143a (1,1,1-trifluoroethane) by continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane using heterogeneous catalysis. The invention offers a simple, convenient, and economical industrial process for manufacturing 143a with very high conversion and selectivity (both over 99%). Previous methods for synthesizing 143a have limitations, such as the use of hazardous and expensive reagents or low productivity due to long contact times in liquid phase processes. The new process uses a combination of iron oxide, rare earth oxide, and zirconium oxide as a catalyst, which has a longer lifetime compared to the catalysts used in previous methods. The invention also discusses various patents and publications related to the production of 143a, highlighting their limitations and comparing them to the present invention.

The present invention relates to organic polymers used in anti-reflective coatings for semiconductor devices, particularly for use in photolithography processes with short wavelength light sources such as 248 nm (KrF) and 193 nm (ArF). These polymers prevent light reflection and eliminate the standing wave effect and diffraction caused by changes in the thickness of the photoresist layer. The anti-reflective composition contains these polymers, alone or in combination with other light-absorbing compounds, and can be prepared using specific reaction equations. The polymers are designed to facilitate light absorption at wavelengths of 193 nm and 248 nm by having groups that absorb light strongly at both wavelengths. The anti-reflective coating can be formed by filtering a solution of a polymer, coating the filtered solution on a wafer, and hard-baking the coating to cross-link the anti-reflective coating polymer. The polymers and compositions of the present invention have proven to be excellent organic anti-reflective coating materials during the formation of submicro-patterns in photolithographic processes using 248 nm KrF and 193 nm ArF lasers.

<summary>

1. The invention describes an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension, with a compact structure, reasonable layout, small weight, and high motive power conversion efficiency.
2. The rotary-wing system is a magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system, comprising magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, a magnetic suspension shaft, and a magnetic suspension guide rail.
3. The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels are suspended in the space restricted by the electromotive ring, the magnetic suspension shaft, and the magnetic suspension guide rail, going around the magnetic suspension shaft under an electromagnetic thrust.
4. The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels comprise blades, a magnetic suspension inner ring, and a magnetic suspension outer ring, forming an impeller.
5. The magnetic suspension inner ring and the magnetic suspension shaft form a repulsive or attractive magnetic suspension radial bearing, while the magnetic suspension inner ring and the magnetic suspension inner ring guide rail form a repulsive or attractive magnetic suspension axial bearing.
6. The magnetic suspension outer ring of the magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels and the magnetic suspension outer ring guide rail form a repulsive or attractive magnetic suspension axial bearing.
7. The magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing wheels, the electromotive ring, and the magnetic suspension shaft constitute a magnetic suspension electric engine.
8. The invention provides two improvement solutions to overcome the problem of reactive torque of the rotary wing, enabling stable and easy power control.
9. The first improvement involves coaxial axial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary wings, while the second improvement features coaxial radial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary wings.
10. The two improvements guarantee coaxial thrusts in the same direction, overcoming or offsetting the reactive torque generated during rotation of the rotary wings, and allowing for automatic control of self-rotating angles and self-rotating angular velocity.

</summary>

The text describes an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension, which aims to make full use of the limited internal space of the saucer shell and provide a compact structure, reasonable layout, small weight, and high motive power conversion efficiency. The rotary-wing system is a magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system, consisting of magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an

This invention describes an improved process for the preparation of certain pyrazolotriazoles from their triazolothiadiazine precursors. The improvement involves a deacylation and desulfurization step conducted in the presence of hypophosphorous acid. This reduces the amount of elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities formed during the reaction. The use of hypophosphorous acid also results in the formation of hydrogen sulfide by-product, which is more easily removed from the reaction zone compared to elemental sulfur. The process is advantageous for industrial applications as it is straightforward, economical, and reduces the formation of detrimental impurities. The invention also provides specific processes for the preparation of 3,6-di-substituted-1H-pyrazolo[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazoles, where R and R' are inert substituents. An inert substituent is defined as a stable, non-reactive group that does not prevent the formation of a compound of this invention. The invention is not critically dependent on the type of groups designated R and R', as long as they meet the three criteria of stability, non-reactivity, and non-interference with compound formation.

The invention describes a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic. The film is cost-effective, has good orientability and thermoformability, and very good optical and mechanical properties. It comprises at least one white pigment, one flame retardant, and one UV absorber. The invention also relates to the use of this film and to a process for its production. Previous films lack UV absorbers and flame retardants, have inadequate thermoformability, and yellow and degrade due to sunlight exposure. EP-A-0 620 245 describes films with improved heat resistance but gives no proposal for improving UV resistance. DE-A 2346 787 describes a flame-retardant polymer that is susceptible to hydrolysis and cakes during drying, making film production difficult. The invention aims to provide a film that is flame retardant, does not embrittle on exposure to heat, is thermoformable, and has high UV resistance. Flame retardancy is defined as passing DIN 4102 Part 2 and Part 1 and UL 94 tests, and high UV resistance means no or minimal damage from sunlight. Thermoformability allows complex and large-surface-area moldings on commercial thermoforming machinery without uneconomic predrying. Good optical properties include uniform coloration, high surface gloss, low light transmission, and a Yellowness Index unchanged from the flame-retardant and UV-modified film. Good mechanical properties include high modulus of elasticity and good tensile stress at break. Good orientability includes excellent orientation in both longitudinal and transverse directions during production without break-offs. Cost-effective production involves drying raw materials or raw material components using industrial-standard dryers without caking or thermal degradation.

The present invention is a frame quilting machine with a separate process controller to control table movement and a separate process controller to control sewing machine operation. The machine allows for precise pattern programming and stitching into large fabrics through the use of a computer aided design feature and a reprogrammable computer. The system also allows for separate reprogramming of the sewing machine function and the pattern through table movement, greatly simplifying the process.

The invention describes a combination electrical cord support and article holder for an ironing board. The cord support keeps the electrical cord of an iron above the ironing surface and includes a holder for an article such as a spray starch can or beverage container. The clamp section of the apparatus can be releasably secured to an ironing board, and the cord support can be pivoted between a raised position and a retracted position. The article holder is mounted to the clamp and can be removed when not in use. The invention also includes an electrical receptacle for receiving the plug of the electrical cord. The apparatus is designed to provide convenience and safety while ironing by keeping necessary items at hand and preventing spills.

The invention describes a buttonhole controlling device for a sewing machine that ensures proper buttonhole formation regardless of the material being sewn. The device includes a foot pad attached to a presser bar, and a traveling assembly with a slidable member that can be positioned by a button for which a buttonhole is to be sewn. The slidable member carries a tab that actuates a tripping lever on the machine to limit the length of the buttonhole. An adjustable stop on the traveling assembly engages the tripping lever to terminate buttonhole formation, preventing open or overlapping stitches. The device is particularly useful for sewing buttonholes in materials that vary in their tendency to slip relative to the feed dog of a sewing machine.

The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for measuring and removing the effects of rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of nip presses used in various industries, with a focus on papermaking. Nip presses are used to exert pressing forces on moving webs to form materials such as paper, textile, plastic foil, and other related materials. The invention uses imbedded sensors in covered rolls to detect variations in pressure along the length of the roll and compensate for rotational variability generated by high-speed rotation of the covered roll. This is achieved by measuring and removing rotational variability from the nip pressure profile to obtain a more true profile of the nip pressure being developed in the nip region. The invention can improve nip loading, leading to higher productivity and lower breakdowns, and can also provide information on the wear of the cover.

The invention describes a sewing machine device that ensures a continuous operation for sewing relatively stiff strips of material. It includes a guide chute for a strip of add-on material, a stop in the feed path of the strip for contacting and stopping the feeding, and control means connected to the sewing machine for controlling the operation based on the position of the stop and the strip material. The device is designed to be simple, rugged, and economical to manufacture.

The present invention describes a method and apparatus for forming a melt spun nonwoven web using a new spinning system that combines the advantages of eductive and non-eductive systems. This system, which also incorporates elements of the meltblown process, addresses many of the problems associated with conventional nonwoven spun bond systems, such as spinning speed limitations, energy consumption, machine element cleanliness, web uniformity, capital costs, and process control. The system is designed to process a wide variety of polymers and other spinable materials, and can produce filaments with varying deniers by adjusting the nozzle opening, air flow rate, exhaust air flow rate, quench air temperature, polymer temperature, polymer viscosity, or polymer throughput per capillary. The filaments are then drawn, cooled, and formed into a non-woven web on a moving mesh wire belt conveyor.

The invention describes a method of connecting two tape-shaped knit pieces using a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds. This method eliminates the need for separate sewing processes, increasing productivity and reducing manufacturing costs.

The dry cleaning machine of the present invention provides an air flow system that brings ambient air into the access opening whenever the door is opened, which is exclusive of the air recirculating system and reduces exhausting the residual solvent vapors from the tubs. A separate intake fan and duct are provided, with the duct interposed between the access opening of the machine housing and the open ends of the interior tubs, and includes a normally closed valve. The system is designed to minimize the loss of solvent vapors when a more expensive and volatile solvent is used. The machine includes a pair of nested tubs, a front opening door, a drive motor, a pump for pumping the dry cleaning solvent, a blower for circulating heated air through the tubs, and a refrigeration system for solvent vapor recovery. The operation of the machine is controlled through a timer mechanism, and includes a washing portion, a drain portion, a spin or centrifuging portion, and a drying portion.

The present invention describes a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image for various consumer applications. The process involves carding and aligning fibers into a feedstock, drawing and reducing the diameter of the feedstock, and spinning it into yarn. The yarn is then wound onto larger packages and used to create a woven or nonwoven fabric. Nonwoven fabrics are made directly from the carding process and are suitable for a wide range of applications. However, they have commonly been disadvantaged in terms of resistance to elongation. Hydroentangled fabrics have been developed with improved properties, but durability is further enhanced through the application of binder compositions and thermal stabilization. Nonwoven composite structures typically improve physical properties through the incorporation of a support layer or scrim. The support layer can be made of various polymers, fibers, or metal screens and is commonly incorporated mechanically or chemically. The present invention describes a two-sided, three-dimensionally imaged nonwoven fabric with a fiber distribution control layer and a support layer or scrim for use in home, medical, and hygiene applications.

The present invention relates to a sewing machine detector that integrates a drive and control system, and utilizes light shielding discs and optical fibers to detect sewing machine control signals. This design provides a more durable, thinner, and more compact detecting section compared to conventional apparatus, and reduces stress on optical fibers while maintaining accurate optical axes. The detector also includes an optical fiber power indicating cable that does not interfere with sewing machine control circuitry.

1. The document describes a sewing machine, an embroidery unit, and a non-transitory computer-readable medium storing a sewing machine control program that allow sewing in a position specified on a work cloth.
2. The sewing machine includes an imaging portion to capture an image of a marker affixed to a specified position on the work cloth, and automatically set the sewing position and angle based on the captured image.
3. However, this method requires affixing and removing the marker, which can be troublesome for the user.
4. The described embodiments provide a sewing machine and an embroidery unit that use ultrasonic waves to detect and set the sewing position, eliminating the need for markers.
5. The sewing machine includes at least one detecting portion to detect ultrasonic waves and a memory with instructions to identify the position of the transmission source of the ultrasonic wave and control sewing based on that position.
6. The embroidery unit can be attached to and detached from the sewing machine bed, and includes at least one detecting portion and a notifying portion to notify the sewing machine of the detection timing of ultrasonic waves.
7. The embroidery unit moves the work cloth based on the position of the transmission source of the ultrasonic wave identified by the sewing machine.

The invention describes a process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness, achieved through simplified treatments during the yarn's helical travel, including completion of coagulation, washing with water of specific composition, drying, and possibly finishing. The process results in a finished yarn with a high degree of white, making other auxiliary treatments unnecessary.

<summary>

The present invention relates to preparations for application onto cellulosic fabric or textile materials, such as cotton or linen, to enhance their utility. The preparation comprises a blended mixture of wool particles or wool powder and a binding agent, with the functional additive carried by the wool particles. The wool particles or wool powder are preferably of macrofibril size or below. This preparation has demonstrated exceptional functional additive-carrying and retention ability, enhancing the durability of functional enhancements of a cellulosic fabric material. The method of preparing the preparation involves pulverizing wool to obtain ultrafine wool powder of macrofibril size and forming an ultrafine wool suspension using the ultrafine wool powder. The functional additive may include additives for ultraviolet protection, anti-bacteria, or other clothing functions. The wool particles or wool powder may have a size of 200 nm or below and a helix or helical structure capable of carrying the functional additives. The functional additive may comprise an anti-UV (ultraviolet light) agent, such as zinc oxide or titanium oxide, or anti-bacterial agents such as nano-silver, zinc oxide, titanium oxide, or other comparable agents. The preparation may be bonded to or deposited onto the cellulosic fabric by printing, padding, or foam application.

</summary>

The invention describes a lockstitch sewing machine with a rotary hook arrangement that minimizes impediment to the guiding of the needle thread loop, particularly during pull-back. The holding means are located on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing, allowing the needle thread loop to expand totally unhindered until maximum expansion. A spring rod offers little resistance during bending, and a capsule release device can further reduce needle thread tension by creating a rotational impulse that allows the needle thread loop to slip through the thread passage gap unhindered. The design is simple, rugged, and economical to manufacture.

The invention describes a traction element, production line, and method for producing a traction element with improved flexibility and adhesion. The traction element has a core strand coated with a flexible thermoplastic plastics material layer before winding peripheral strand cords around it. The production line features an extruder with a thread guide and matrix that can be adjusted to control the spacing of the stranded cables. The method involves degreasing and preheating the unwound stranded cables before sheathing them with a liquefied plastics material in the extruder. The improved adhesion between the stranded cables and the plastics material jacket ensures better performance and longevity of the traction element.

The text describes an invention for controlling thread tension in a spool creel. The invention includes a plurality of controllers, each associated with a spool holder and having a brake rotor and adjustable braking element. A tensioning lever, coupled to the braking element, is biased by the threads and operable to occupy an angular position dependent upon thread tension and weight. A biasing arrangement, activated by fluid pressure, is connected to the tensioning lever to influence the tensioning lever and alter thread tension. The invention allows for centralized setting of thread tension for the entire creel and can rapidly increase braking force when the warping machine is shut off. The biasing arrangement can follow the swinging movement of the tensioning lever and prevent contamination of the threads. The tensioning lever can ensure that the braking shoe is removed from contact with the braking surface on restart of the warping machine. The braking element can be a braking band or a magnetic system.

This text describes a continuation of an abandoned patent application for a fabric treatment apparatus. The invention is an improved version of existing apparatuses for treating a textile web with a liquid, such as a washing or rinsing solution. The apparatus includes a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch. The conveyor is an endless sieve belt that transports the textile web along a predetermined horizontal path. The applicator applies the liquid to the web during motion, and the suction device removes the liquid from the web by a suction process during motion. The dwell stretch conducts the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop. This allows for a longer action time of the applied liquid on the substances to be removed from the fabric or textile web, resulting in a surprising improvement of the washing effect. The apparatus is especially advantageous for printed material, as it allows for effective washing without soiling a white background. A preferred area of application is soilage washing, which can remove considerable amounts of soilage at relatively little expense. The dwell stretch device can be formed by an air pass, wherein the textile web is completely free of support or guiding elements at least along major portions of the dwell stretch and is accessible to the atmosphere at all sides. Alternatively, the dwell stretch can include at least one freely rotatable drum disposed above the upper section of the sieve belt, with at least two rollers disposed laterally adjacent to one another below the drum for guiding the web to and from the drum. This particular embodiment is especially suitable for certain less resistant materials such as knitted fabrics. The apparatus can have a compact construction, and the suction device can cause the textile web to adhere to the belt and be entrained thereby, guiding the web over several rollers without appreciable longitudinal tensile stresses occurring in the web.

The document describes a method for producing silicon-based nanowires and films using liquid silanes, polymers, accelerants, and solvents. The method involves electrospinning a viscous solution of these materials onto a substrate, followed by thermal processing to transform the deposited fibers into silicon-based materials. The invention also relates to the use of four-component and five-component inks in electrospinning procedures for the formation of micro and nanofibers, which can be used in various applications including material composites, electronic devices, sensors, photodetectors, batteries, ultracapacitors, and photosensitive substrates. The methods and materials of the invention can be used to produce silicon-containing wires with targeted conductivities and structural stability, and can avoid the formation of excessive surface oxide and carbide phases that negatively affect capacity and rate capabilities. The inks and methods are appropriate for any electrospinning technique, including devices with multiple nozzles, drums, or films.

The source document describes a splice for a soil reinforcing element and a composite soil reinforcing element. The splice includes wave plates with transverse protrusions to receive and seat transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip, and a connective device to couple the wave plates together and clamp down on the longitudinal wires. The composite soil reinforcing element includes a soil reinforcing element, a grid-strip, and a splice to couple them together.

The present invention provides a dampening system for bracing the frame of a structure during a dynamic event, specifically a load-limiting device for braced frames that can undergo plastic deformation to limit the loads levied on a structure during a dynamic event. This device can be easily removed and replaced after plastic deformation with another non-plastically deformed load-limiting device. The load-limiting device is able to plastically deform in response to a load applied thereto, and can be constructed of a plastic material or a metal-based elasto-plastic material. The device is attached to a brace in the braced frame structure through a connection means, and is able to dissipate energy in the braced frame structure.

The invention introduces biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio. Traditional composite structures rely on isotropic metallic properties, but BTR composites take advantage of composite materials' tailorable anisotropic properties. The FOMD process, which includes topology optimization, is used to design materials specifically for their functions and loading conditions. The BTR concept involves fibers, stuffers, and joints, with fibers concentrated and optimally arranged along load paths. The composite structure includes tendons/muscles, ribs/bones, joints, flesh, skins, and shell. The two-dimensional material concept can be extended to a three-dimensional lattice for various applications. The BTR composite can also be used to develop lightweight composite armor for future combat systems.

The present invention relates to a portable, temporary guard rail support for use in the construction industry to provide a safe work area for workmen working at dangerous heights. The guard rail support comprises a base plate, an upright column, rail supporting brackets, a retaining flange, an angle brace, and a safety tie-off ring. The guard rail support can be used to construct a safety barrier with upper and lower wooden rails and a kick board. The safety tie-off ring can serve as retaining and attachment means for a safety cable or to fasten weatherproof tarpaulins. The guard rail support can be secured to a floor or ground surface using suitable fasteners, or it can be used with a concrete-filled steel base for greater stability and support. The guard rail support can also be used with a mesh-like fence structure to form a mesh-like safety barrier. The guard rail support is designed to adhere to safety regulations and provides for easy installation and removal at construction sites.

<summary>

1. The document describes a patent for a small deaeration tank designed to deaerate pulp treated with oxygen before washing.
2. The tank is designed to be placed on top of an oxygen reactor and have no moving parts.
3. The system uses the filtrate from the washer after the oxygen bleach as the swirling fluid in the deaeration tank.
4. The tank is a cylindrical tank with an open top and a flat bottom, and the inlet pipe should allow the pulp to enter the tank above the surface of the slurry.
5. The outlet is located in the bottom plate of the deaeration tank and is sized to handle the amount of pulp leaving the tank.
6. The height of the slurry in the tank is controlled by a height sensor at the bottom of the tank, which controls the flow in the outlet pipe by operating the valve between the deaeration tank and the washer.

</summary>

Note: The above summary is a brief and general description of the patent and the deaeration tank system it describes. It is not an exhaustive or technical explanation of the system and its components. For a more detailed understanding, it is recommended to refer to the full patent document.

The invention describes a new and improved safe and door structure, which is a readily assembled, low cost door and safe structure. The safe has a valuables receiving chamber with a generally rectangular opening, and a plateshaped separate steel door that can be placed on inwardly extending ledges on opposing walls. The door is retained in the chamber by a set of grooves formed on the opposite walls, providing stops for retaining the door therein. A lock assembly on the reverse side of the door has the latch bolt engaging a detent in one bar for prevention of lateral movement.

The present invention is a building system that allows for the creation of larger exterior panels without the need for movement control joints, and a cavity wall plaster system that can provide walls of considerable size and non-square or non-rectangular perimeters. The system is designed to create at least square or rectangular panels that can achieve a height of up to 4.85 meters and a width of up to 12 meters without mandatory movement control joints. The system is also designed to cater to thicker panels, such as those used in other countries, and can be used to form stucco walled structures with panel rigidity and integrity. The system is compliant with the plaster code NZS4251 and the building code NZS3604.

The provided document is a patent application for a method and system for measuring fluid pressures in geological formations. The system aims to accurately measure the fluid pressure in a formation at a specific depth, without being influenced by pressures in the formation above and below the measurement apparatus. The invention is related to the civil engineering, hydro-geology, and petroleum industries, and can be used in various applications such as monitoring foundation pore pressures, groundwater resources, and petroleum fluid pressures. The system includes a pressure transducer that is cemented in a borehole at the desired depth, and a method for creating a communication path between the formation and the pressure transducer while isolating it from other pressures in the borehole. The system can also include a hydrofracture process to ensure connectivity between the formation and the pressure transducer.

<summary>

1. The present invention is a pulsed power device and a method for Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) using pulsed power.
2. Pulsed power is the rapid release of electrical energy stored in capacitor banks, which can be harnessed in various industrial, chemical, or medical applications.
3. The energy release from the system can be used in a plasma mode or by discharging the energy through a coil to generate a short-lived but intense magnetic field.
4. In the plasma mode, a spark gap or exploding filament is used to create a plasma channel that vaporizes the surrounding water, generating high pressures and temperatures.
5. The pulsed power discharge generates a strong electromagnetic pulse that travels at the speed of light across the reservoir, inducing a coupled acoustic vibration at very high frequencies in geologic materials.
6. This induced acoustic vibration acts for a short period of time after the pulse is discharged, stimulating the reservoir at multiple scales.
7. The present invention also recognizes the importance of higher frequencies for effective mobilization of oil and increasing production.
8. A multi-level discharge device is used to extend the effective range of the stimulation by sequentially firing several sources in one well in a time sequence.
9. The invention can be customized to produce specific frequencies that activate specific scales of inclusions in the reservoir, preventing activation of those inclusions that might inhibit enhanced production.

</summary>

The present invention relates to a plow blade with a novel design that provides a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, produced with basic manufacturing processes for efficient production. The blade construction includes a multiple component assembly, allowing for the ability to rebuild a blade and replace a portion that may be worn. Ejecting a specific fluid at specific points along the plow blade maximizes desirable characteristics while minimizing the volume of ejected fluid. This method is adaptable in static plowing and vibratory plowing utilities. Lubricating the sides of the blade/chute that come into contact with the ground with fluid has been found to greatly reduce the amount of drag (friction). The plow blade consists of a blade, leading edge sections, point, and a fluid tube. The blade further includes a front edge, a top end, and a bottom end. The bottom end is adapted to support a variety of points, the type of which may be dependent upon the soil conditions of a particular job. A component of the present invention is the manner in which the components are assembled to form flow paths for fluid to exit the blade at controlled locations and with a controlled flow rate.

The invention describes an adjustable swimming pool vacuum head that can easily regulate the suction being exerted by the suction head during the pool cleaning operation. The adjustment mechanisms are conveniently located on the top of the vacuum head and can be quickly operated by hand without the need for hand tools. The suction exerted by the vacuum head can be precisely regulated without the need for regulation of the remotely located suction source. The invention can also be provided in kit form which can be interconnected with certain types of existing, prior art pool cleaning devices without the need for major retrofit of the existing devices.

The invention describes an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings in oil well drilling tools, which can be mounted on a drill string. The apparatus includes a sub-unit with a mandrel and a retriever section that can slide along the mandrel and engage with an extended J-slot of a wear bushing. The retriever section is prevented from rotational movement but allowed vertical movement to prevent damage to the retriever unit or the wear bushing. The apparatus can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieval of the drill bit from the hole.

<summary>

1. The invention describes a bedroom cabinet, particularly a unit type bedroom cabinet for a flophouse facility with individual rooms in an existing building.
2. The bedroom cabinet is box-shaped, made of an outer casing and an inner casing, and has a flat external surface for efficient use of space and stacking.
3. The outer casing is made of upper and lower outer casings, while the inner casing comprises a front surface panel, a back panel, left and right side panels, a ceiling panel, and a bottom panel.
4. The front surface panel of the inner casing has an opening for an exit, and the bottom panel has a mat.
5. A clearance between the outer and inner casings allows for the installation of boxes for electric devices or user belongings without projection.
6. The clearance can also house wirings or other components for interior electric devices.
7. In a further embodiment, spacer members with venting grooves are interposed in the clearance around the inner casing, forming a uniform air flow passage for natural ventilation and increased sound-proofing.
8. The bedroom cabinet can be assembled by placing the lower half of the inner casing into the lower outer casing and then fitting the upper outer casing on top.
9. The two flanges of the upper and lower outer casings are held together by a clip member and an ornamental web, and an edge frame is mounted over the exit notches and opening.
10. Articles, such as a TV receiver, can be mounted within the assembled bedroom cabinet, and a sheet can cover the mat, which can be wound and pressed against the mat by keep members.

</summary>

The present invention relates to a lock device for preventing a work machine, such as an excavating device, loader, or crane, from being tilted by its own weight. The lock device is manually operable and includes an engaging member and an engaged member that can be easily locked and released. The engaging member is supported by a guide member and a support pin, and can be held in the lock position or the lock release position by sliding it along the slot and touching the guide member with either the first or second surface. The guide member does not become horizontal while the boom is rotated, allowing the engaging member to maintain the lock position at any rotation position between the highest and lowest positions. This simplifies the lock device and reduces cost by eliminating the need for a holding mechanism.

The invention describes a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints with an expansion function and a method of mounting an elastic member therein. It is useful in applications such as vehicle traveling path joints in new transit systems, monorails, road bed plate joints in road bridges, and footbridges. The jointing structure includes steps provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, elastic members mounted inside the steps, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap. The structure aims to prevent tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations for smooth and safe vehicle traveling. The elastic members are made of a material that is hard to be deformed vertically and easy to be deformed horizontally. The joint block is made of the same concrete as the traveling path or high-strength fiber-reinforced concrete for increased slip resistance. The method of mounting an elastic member includes joining the elastic members across the expansion gap, fixing one side to a step, deforming the elastic member toward the bridge girder axis, and fixing the other side to the step.

The present invention is a floor track system for use in a fluid treatment chamber, specifically designed for moving wheeled trucks or similar equipment in and out of the chamber without contaminating the sanitary environment. The system includes a wheel channel with opposed sidewalls and a cover plate, which prevent showered fluid or fluid on the floor from entering the wheel channel area and becoming contaminated by the truck wheels. The cover plate can be connected to the longer sidewall by a hinge to facilitate cleaning of the channel. In another embodiment, the system utilizes inflatable elastomer seals along the top edges of the sidewalls to enclose around the hand truck wheel struts and prevent entry of the brine solution into the guide track. The invention is well adapted for use in a meat product chilling chamber, where wheeled hand trucks carry meat products into a sanitary chilling chamber using fluid as a quick cooling agent, eliminating contamination and allowing for the reuse of the cooling fluid. The invention enhances the recovery and reuse of the brine solution, preserving natural resources and achieving an economic advantage.

The present invention is a down hole heating system designed to improve the flow of oil and gas in wells where viscosity and paraffin build-up are impeding production. The system includes a heating unit with electrical resistance heater rods, insulating packers, and a stainless steel collar to contain the heat in the production zone. The electrical connections are shielded from physical and chemical attack and shorts caused by conductive fluids. The system can be used with a method for heat treating an oil or gas well for improving well flow, and can also be used in combination with cable for supporting the heating unit during other well treatments or maintenance.

The source document describes a ladder attachment that improves lateral stability, prevents damage to the work surface, and allows the ladder to straddle corners. The attachment includes a brace with a flange and a U-bolt that secures the brace to the ladder rung, and a resilient pad that contacts the work surface. The brace is connected to the ladder siderail with a clamp, and the pad is pivotally connected to the brace to allow for movement and adjustment. The attachment can be made of heavy gauge material or reinforced with additional bolts for use with less substantial ladders.

The present invention is a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool. The nails are assembled in a staggered or stepped manner and held in place by a plastic material that is molded and adheres to the nails, reducing debris and increasing rigidity. The plastic material can be a blend of polypropylene and a maleic anhydride modified polypropylene, and is formulated to adhere to preheated nails. The strip can also include notches or weakened regions to influence separation of the connecting portion from the collar at a desired location, reducing impact and further minimizing debris. The strip can be configured for use in coiled fastener driving tools by eliminating reinforcing elements and using bridges with varying radius transitions. Other features include tapered collars, eccentric nail placement, and neck regions to further reduce debris and improve nail penetration.

This document describes a desmodromic valve actuation system for intake and exhaust function of a four-stroke piston in internal combustion engines, which eliminates the use of springs to close the valves. The system uses a timing belt to connect the engine crankshaft to a camshaft, which has cams for each intake and exhaust valve in each cylinder. The cams displace the valves inwardly to open the ports, and a controllable actuating means is used to close the ports, which is substantially infinitely variable in displacement. This system allows for precise control of the valve timing and duration, which can improve engine performance and fuel efficiency.

The source document describes a lighting system for aquariums using LED lights with separate control channels for different colors of light, such as white and blue. The system allows for manual control of the color temperature and intensity of the light, as well as remote control through radio frequency (RF) signals. The lighting system can also be controlled with in-line timers for setting on/off times and dimming duration. The system can also be used for lighting underneath cabinets.

The invention describes a position sensor that includes a waveform generator and an error correction generator. The waveform generator modifies an unconditioned sensing signal from a transducer based on an error correction signal from the error correction generator, providing a conditioned sensing signal. The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about the position of an object being sensed, and can constantly compare a value of the conditioned sensing signal to a desired minimum value to generate a correction signal. A window reference circuit can constantly compare a desired conditioned sensor signal output to an existing conditioned sensor signal output and adjust the conditioned sensor signal output if it is above a preset high reference signal or below a preset low reference signal. The sensor can be remotely connected to a sensor monitoring system via two wires, making it desirable for multiplexing with other sensors.

The invention describes a system and method for controlling a fuel delivery system, such as a throttle valve, in a vehicle. The system allows for smooth switching between automatic and manual control, preventing the vehicle from lurching or stalling, and provides full operation of the vehicle under manual control.

<summary>

1. The present application is related to stave floors, specifically modular composed stave floors.
2. Thin sight substrates in existing stave floors can deform or become detached during maintenance, compromising the floor's appearance and functionality.
3. The invention aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of sight substrates and increase the floors' useful life.
4. The method includes using a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm.
5. Both substrates are assembled together with glue and multidirectional holding means, such as dendrites, adhesion, and reinforcement means.
6. The new composition prevents displacement or changes in dimensions, ensuring a stronger bond between the sheets.
7. Improved composed stave floors have a longer lifespan and allow for corrective maintenance.
8. Preferred glazes with higher hardness can be applied by the supplier, eliminating the need for on-site application.
9. The example embodiment has been shown to increase floor durability and resist deformation and detachment.

</summary>

Note: The above summary is based on the provided text and condenses the main points into 9 sentences.

<summary>

1. The invention describes a downhole vibratory tool capable of delivering high amplitude, low frequency oscillating forces to a stuck fish, allowing a wireline or other tools to pass through a central passage.
2. The tool has an outer body attached to a stuck object, an upper and lower end, and a mandrel extending uphole from the upper end, which is connected to the surface through a string.
3. The mandrel has a passage that is in fluid communication with the passage in the string so that pressure can be delivered from the surface to lateral ports.
4. A row of ports leads to an annular space with which there is communication to a piston attached to the mandrel, which imparts a downward force when pressure is applied.
5. Stacking pistons in effect increases the area of total pistons exposed to the applied pressure, increasing the delivered power of the tool.
6. A drop-in plug is used to close off the passage, and a dump valve is disposed annularly about the central passage, which opens and closes without getting slammed against a seat.
7. The tool can be run in a manner where high amplitude, low frequency oscillating forces are delivered to the stuck fish without impacts of the pistons on the housing.
8. The tool's design aims to improve reliability, increase power delivery, and allow for wireline access, addressing issues with prior designs.
9. The tool's components are designed to be more beefy, and the mandrel is powered by stacked pistons in the tool body to magnify the delivered power.
10. The tool can be configured to apply power to the mandrel for a down cycle when the dump valve closes close to the point where the pistons reach their upward travel limit, achieving a longer power stroke.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention describes a precast concrete retaining wall system with a base and a face panel connected by a counterfort. The counterfort extends perpendicularly from the face panel and its base extends rearward. Reinforcing bars (rebar) are cast within the counterfort and base for additional strength. A shear key can be used to solidify the connection between the face panel or counterforts and the base. The connection between the face panel and base is made by inserting an end of a piece of rebar of one module into an opening in the other module and then sealing the connection with grout. Measures can be taken to prevent the base from sliding once it is backfilled and surcharge loads are applied, such as texturing or roughening the bottom of the base, setting the base on shims with holes or ports for grout, or using H-piles for added stability. A vehicle impact barrier can be formed and cast-in-place on top of the wall or behind the wall. The features of the invention can be combined in any combination, and each feature can be replaced by alternative features serving the same purpose.
</summary>

The summary provides a concise overview of the invention, highlighting the key components and features of the precast concrete retaining wall system. It explains how the face panel and base are connected using rebar and grout, and how a shear key can be used to solidify the connection. It also describes measures that can be taken to prevent the base from sliding, such as texturing or roughening the bottom, setting the base on shims with holes for grout, or using H-piles for added stability. Finally, it mentions the possibility of forming a vehicle impact barrier on top of or behind the wall. The summary also notes that the features of the invention can be combined in any way and that each feature can be replaced by an alternative serving the same purpose.

The source text describes a nozzle for applying sealants, such as silicones, in the manufacturing of machines and other artifacts in various industries. The nozzle includes a bell or hood shaped tip and an injection button, and is designed to facilitate the injection of sealants in multiple industrial applications. The nozzle is made of plastic, such as polypropylene, and has a main elongated hollow body with a truncated cone shape and a first end with a wider diameter, and a second end with a bell or hood shaped section. The bell shaped section is sized to encapsulate rivets or nuts and has an annular flanged section connected to an injection button. The injection button has a circular main body with a peripheral groove section, a hollow central circular protrusion with multiple series of radially oriented channels ending in orifices, and a series of lateral grooves or openings in an alternative embodiment. The nozzle can be connected to a sealant cartridge or injection machine using a threaded exterior surface on the connecting hollow round section. The annular flanged section of the bell shaped section cooperatively matches with the peripheral groove of the injection button, allowing a strong and firm non-permanent connection. The nozzle can be used to apply sealants in a variety of ways, including towards the chamfers in which the rivet heads are adjusted or towards the walls of the orifice in which the screws are inserted. The nozzle can simplify the sealing work, reduce sealant application time, and provide a more economical sealing process.

This document describes a fluid pump for pumping liquids at high volumetric flow rates and high pressures. The pump includes multiple pump heads, each with an impeller and a housing, arranged in series so that fluid flows from one pump head to the next. The pump heads are connected to each other so that the outlet of one pump head is in direct fluid communication with the inlet of the next pump head. The pump heads are commonly driven by a drive shaft that passes through the inlet of each pump head. A biconical tubular connector frictionally secures the drive shaft in the hollow interior of the connector, preventing fluid from entering the drive train and causing rotation of the impellers. The pump can be mounted on a support structure such as a wheeled boom, a hitching assembly, or a trailer for operation at a fluid reservoir.

This patent describes a method and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or waste fuels such as wood waste. The invention aims to provide a clean burning waste fuel burner that emits minimal quantities of particulate materials and operates with little slag or clinkers. It is self-regulating, easy to control, and has fast response times to changes in the load. The method forms a conical pile of waste fuel with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile, drying and gasifying the waste fuel. The volatile gases driven off the pile are partially oxidized by additional combustion air in a primary combustion chamber, and then move into a secondary combustion chamber for complete combustion. The primary and secondary chambers can be added to any source of dirty particulate-laden combustible gas to burn the gas and remove the particulate for meeting environmental emission standards. The invention can be used for a wood waste burner, but it can also be used for other applications such as burning the gases from a coking operation and removing particulate from the exhaust.

The text describes a mounting link for use in attaching a gearbox to an engine, such as an aircraft gas turbine engine. The mounting link includes a female link and a male link that can translate relative to each other, as well as a pin that selectively retains the two links and can shear under extreme loads to allow a permitted range of motion. This design allows the mounting link to absorb extreme shocks without transmitting destructive loads from the engine to the gearbox. The female and male links include features for attaching to the engine and gearbox, and the radial interface between the links provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by translation. The use of a shearable pin and coulomb damping obviates the need for other linkages and peripheral connections to withstand extreme loads, reducing weight and material requirements.

The text describes an evaporative cooler system that uses a heat exchanger to separate evaporating water from the cooling air stream, achieving sensible cooling. The system draws at least a major portion of the working air from the room to be cooled, as it has a lower wet bulb temperature than outside air, resulting in a larger temperature differential and more efficient cooling. The system includes an array of spaced vertically directed hollow elongated tubular members, with the wet side accomplished by gravity flow of water downwardly along the inner surfaces of the tubes in conjunction with countercurrent flow of returned air from the load, and the dry side accomplished by fresh air flowing in thermal conductive contact with the outer surfaces of the tubular members for cooling. The cooled fresh air is then delivered to the enclosure. The system can cool an enclosure more quickly or achieve a lower temperature, but at a higher energy cost, by diverting a portion of the return air to mix with the fresh air or a portion of the cooled air streams to mix with the working return air. The system includes various components such as blowers, ductwork, a water pump, and a plenum that serves as a sump for containing a reservoir of water for evaporation.

<summary>
This invention relates to a mechanism for installing and retrieving downhole objects in wells, specifically for connecting a pull tool to a downhole object or fish and disconnecting it if needed. During drilling and well servicing operations, objects may become stuck or lost in the well bore, and fishing operations are required to remove them. This invention aims to improve the connection and disconnection of fishing tools to worn fishing necks.

The invention can be used as an external pull tool or overshot, or as an internal pull tool or spear, and is adapted for wire line service operations. It consists of an outer tubular body with an inner body structure that moves telescopically, causing the overshot or spear to selectively move into gripping relation with the object to be removed. The tool structure is secured about the inner body by a catch mechanism with a locking and unlocking position.

A collet type device is used for establishing internal connection with the object, and an external grapple device with external teeth can be substituted for internal gripping. The tool can be used for overshot type grappling and removal of objects from well bores.

A tool connector sub, piston and guide element, tool support sub, and nose cone element are used to engage the collet elements with the object. The collet elements are properly positioned relative to the internal shoulder of the object, and the tool connector sub establishes communication between the passage of the connector sub and an annulus or chamber.

A controllable locking mechanism is provided for controlling, locking, and unlocking the collet or spear slip structures with respect to the object. The locking mechanism incorporates guide pins and latching recesses that function together to provide controlled guiding or tracking movement.

The pulling tool structure is controlled by relative rotation of the inner and outer body portions, and a plurality of spring elements ensure alternate latching and unlatching of the pulling tool mechanism. The tool can be unlatched simply by causing limited axial movement of the inner and outer housings and then causing relative movement of the inner and outer housings in the opposite direction.

The upper portion of the outer housing structure is defined by an internally threaded portion that is adapted for threaded connection to an externally threaded portion of an upper closure or cap structure. The compression spring element functions to maintain the

The text describes an invention related to archery equipment that improves the attachment of arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts and balances arrow shafts. The invention includes a point cap system with a point cap and a balance pin, which can be adjusted in size and weight to achieve perfect balance. The design also prevents dirt from entering the arrow shaft when the points are not attached and allows for the replacement of threaded point cap members if damaged. Additionally, the invention utilizes the strength of reinforcing fibers in unidirectional shafts and provides a means for uniformly encapsulating the end of an arrow shaft with a material of nearly equal strength in all directions. The invention also includes a point adaptor with internal threads for threaded receipt of various types of arrow points with external threads, and a nock cap adaptor for attaching nocks to the end of an arrow shaft.

<summary>

The present invention introduces a cooled flow deflection apparatus for high-temperature fluid-flow machines, focusing on improving cooled stator or rotor blades in gas turbines. Current flow deflection apparatuses have cooling channels cast into their structure, but this method has several disadvantages such as increased material in the transition region, thermal stresses, high blade weight, and complex casting processes. The invention proposes using separate inserts for the separating walls, which are inserted into the apparatus and secured, instead of casting them together. This method reduces material in the transition region, eliminates thermal stresses, lowers blade weight, and simplifies casting development.

A preferred embodiment includes a hollow casting with integrally formed rails for inserting separating walls, ensuring simple assembly, attachment, and sealing. Another embodiment suggests securing the inserted separating walls with an integral material joint, such as soldering or welding, for a more robust seating. The separating walls can be straight or bent into a U-shape for deflecting cooling fluid. The invention is particularly advantageous for gas turbine blades, simplifying their complex geometry and allowing for easier cooling system adjustments.

</summary>

In simpler terms, the invention describes a more efficient way to cool flow deflection apparatuses, like gas turbine blades, by using separate inserts for cooling channels' separating walls instead of casting them together. This method offers various benefits, such as reduced material and weight, eliminated thermal stresses, and easier casting development. The document also provides specific embodiments, like hollow castings with rails for inserting walls and securing them with material joints, which further improve the overall design and functionality.

The invention describes an engine with a reduced number of engine compression release brakes, which varies braking horsepower by operating less than all of the engine brakes. This design reduces engine components, improving overall robustness. The engine includes an engine housing with a portion of the engine cylinders having an engine compression release brake.
