Ted is considering calling her, but Barney ends the friendship over Ted's decision to dump a porn star. Meanwhile, Robin is offered a promotion to cover the City Hall beat, but she declines Barney's offer to say "booger" on live TV for money. Later, she says "nipple" on the news, and Barney convinces her to do another challenge for more money. Ted finds Natalie's number and calls her, but she hangs up on him. When he tells his friends about it, they ask why she would hang up on him, and Ted reveals that he broke up with her on her birthday by leaving a message on her answering machine. Lily gets angry and tells Ted that he should never break up with a girl on her birthday. Ted realizes his mistake and decides to make things right with Natalie. He goes to her apartment and apologizes, and they start dating again. However, when Natalie has to leave for her Krav Maga class, Ted's friends tell him that he should break up with her because she is not the one. Ted struggles to find the right words to break up with Natalie, but in the end, he tells her the truth, and she gets angry and throws spaghetti at him. The story ends with Ted being beaten up by Natalie, but the narrator reveals that within a year, Natalie was married with three beautiful children. The story teaches the lesson that sometimes things happen for a reason, even if they don't seem to make sense at the time.

Jamie is arrested for being involved with a drug dealer, Seth Phelps, who J.R. went to high school with. Babe confronts J.R. about his connection to Seth and Jamie's arrest, and J.R. reveals that he thinks Seth drugged Babe to get back at him.

Ryan and Annie are discussing the possibility of ending their marriage, while Greenlee asks Zach for help in winning back Aidan. Jack and Erica are working on getting Carmen's sentence reduced, and Tad and Krystal are throwing a birthday party for their daughter. Meanwhile, Jesse shares stories about his late sister Jenny with his great-niece, who is named after her.

Erica is being held prisoner and pleads with her captor to let her keep photographs of her fiancé and daughter. Liza is informed that the DNA evidence used to convict Griffin Castillo may not be his, and Tad urges her to reopen the investigation. Kendall takes Ricky hostage and demands to know where Bianca is, but Ricky refuses to tell her and instead tries to manipulate Kendall into surrendering the gun.

Erica Kane and Adam Chandler have a tense reunion as Adam seeks Erica's help, revealing that he found Tad Martin's missing daughter, Kate, who is actually Julia Santos' daughter, Kathy. Tad is overjoyed to be reunited with his daughter and wants to tell her about Julia, while Krystal tries to cut ties with Adam for good. Ryan Lavery struggles with memories of his past with Annie Lavery, while Greenlee Smythe and Aidan Devane confront their feelings for each other.

At a wedding reception, a gunman takes several people hostage, including Angie Hubbard. Tad, Angie's uncle, is shot while trying to help. Jake and Frankie work to save Tad, who is losing a lot of blood and in danger of going into shock. Robert, the gunman, is revealed to be Jesse's long-lost brother and former FBI agent. Julia Keefer, a friend of Krystal's, is shot and taken to the hospital. Despite efforts to save her, she dies from her injuries.

Annie is excited about planning her wedding with Scott and considers various locations, including the Empire State Building and a local club. She also thinks about eloping to Vegas. Marissa is upset after failing the bar exam and confides in Caleb. Ryan's daughter, Emma, is upset about losing a special dress given to her by Greenlee. Greenlee offers to have a new dress made with the same embroidered message. J.R. and Scott argue about their family businesses and J.R.'s treatment of Marissa. David confronts Ryan about trying to contact Greenlee.

Annie has been remembering more things and reveals that Tori, a girl who has been helping her remember, is actually a childhood friend who went missing and whom Annie believes she killed. Adam, who has been reported missing, shows up at the hospital where Ian is recovering from heart surgery. Erica is concerned about Adam's health and tells J.R. the truth about Adam's hospital admission. Adam asks Erica for help in dealing with his medical condition and the kidnapping charges against him. Kendall and Zach worry about Ian's recovery and blame each other for their failed marriage. Dr. Burke tries to find out more about Tori from Annie and Aidan.

Taylor goes to the hospital to have her foot checked out by her friend Dr. Franklin Hubbard, but he's not on duty yet. Jake, another doctor, examines her foot and diagnoses her with plantar fasciitis. Babe, Kendall, and Greenlee are discussing a new hire for Fusion when Annie quits in a fit of anger. Amanda receives a package from Jake with a pirate costume and is excited to wear it to ConFusion at 3:00 pm. Frankie and Randi are discussing Fletcher and his demands when Frankie receives a text from his father asking to meet in person. Kendall tells Greenlee about a key she found hidden in Annie's frame and her suspicions about what it might open.

Erica confronts Ethan about Zach's innocence, but Ethan insists on his claims against Zach. Greenlee and Kendall argue about Ethan's lies, and Greenlee warns Simone about Ethan. Jack asks Reggie for help with Lily regarding Zach's case. Braden threatens Jonathan, who is trying to protect Greenlee. Ryan confronts his former teacher, Mr. Hewlett, about the abuse he suffered as a child. Zach asks Livia to help him get out of jail, and Ethan threatens Erica over the phone. Kendall becomes hysterical when Lily insists that Zach is innocent, and Erica and Jack try to calm her down. The episode ends with ominous messages from David, Jack, Ethan, and Erica.

Erica Kane and Carmen Morales are at the apartment of Armando's mother, Louisa, to offer them the opportunity to star in Erica's new reality show. Louisa is hesitant at first, but eventually agrees after Erica explains that the show will focus on the struggles of single mothers. Meanwhile, Jack and Zach are trying to find Erica and Carmen before they get into trouble, as they believe that Erica is planning to confront Armando and get him to confess to the bank robbery. Kendall is taking care of a drunk and emotional Aidan, who is regretting proposing to Greenlee and causing tension between Kendall and Zach. Annie is meeting with her lawyer, Livia, to finalize her divorce papers from Ryan, but Livia tries to convince her to reconsider, as she believes that Ryan's memory may eventually return.

Julia Santos, a former witness in the federal protection program, is being hunted by her ex-boyfriend Kevin and his associates. Tad Martin, Julia's ex-husband, is trying to protect her and is seeking information about Kevin from Dixie Cooney, who was in prison with Kevin. Meanwhile, Ryan Lavery, who is believed to be dead, is alive and on the run with his brother Jonathan, who needs medical attention. Ryan seeks help from Erin Lavery, his ex-wife, to get Jonathan to the hospital without revealing Ryan's identity.

Damon takes care of Colby after she has a hard time dealing with the aftermath of a party where a man died. A.J., the son of Marissa and the late David, asks about his grandfather's death and is comforted by Marissa and Krystal. Asher, a new employee at Chandler Enterprises, reveals to J.R. that he lied about attending a prestigious university on his resume. Greenlee takes responsibility for her role in David's death and plans to come clean about everything she did.

Frankie's family, including his estranged sister Natalia and her mother Rebecca, attend a charity event in Pine Valley. Jake and Taylor reunite and share a dance. David and Krystal flirt, causing tension between her and Tad. Annie, Ryan's ex-wife, shows up at the event with a knife, causing panic. She believes she is getting married to Ryan, but has injured Erica in the process.

Erin is stretching in the park when she hears rustling leaves and then trips and falls. Erica is determined to get revenge on Dr. Greg Madden, whom she believes is responsible for tearing her family apart. Jack and Zach argue about Kendall's actions and Jack's treatment of her. Kendall tries to explain to Greenlee why she carried Greenlee's baby, but Greenlee is beyond listening. Greg and Josh argue about the morality of Greg's actions. Erica asks Tad to investigate Greg Madden and find a connection to her past.

Maddie has a surprise for her Valentine's Day date, Nate. Jack is working a double shift and won't be home for dinner, much to Carly's disappointment. Holden and Lily are expecting a new baby, and Jade, Rose's daughter, is there to help out.

Aaron and Alison are at a party, discussing their relationship when Aaron gets a call from his brother Will. Will reveals that Emily is the one who has been sneaking into Fairwinds and tormenting Rosanna. Alison doesn't believe him and is worried about the impact on her family. Meanwhile, Emily is volunteering to take a polygraph test to prove her innocence. Hal is supportive but Rosanna is skeptical. Paul visits Emily to ask her why she would do such a thing and Emily maintains her innocence. Later, Paul shows Hal a picture of Emily buying the same type of doll that was used in the tormenting incidents, causing Hal to question Emily's innocence.

Brad and Katie are trying to conceive a baby through artificial insemination with Henry as the sperm donor. Vienna, who is married to Henry, is willing to carry the baby for them. Meanwhile, Luke is feeling lost and unsure about his future, but Noah encourages him to keep trying and figure things out. Lucinda is undergoing radiation therapy for her illness and Lily apologizes for not being more sensitive to her condition. Lucinda encourages Lily to attend a meeting at Luke's foundation in his place as she is familiar with the business and knows Grant Moran.

Barbara provides information about a hunting lodge with a well that James Steinbeck and Paul used to visit, which leads the search party to believe that Lily and Rose might be there. Meanwhile, Carly and Jack get married in a beautiful ceremony surrounded by their friends and family.

Jennifer, the co-owner of Street Jeans, feels guilty for missing most of the press conference to relaunch the company. Her brother, Paul, and mother, Barbara, offer to help her with the business and planning her wedding. Meanwhile, Holden is concerned about Lily's new friend, Keith, who is moving into the guest house and has a lot of debt. Jack, Holden's friend, is reluctant to investigate Keith further due to a past mistake. At a dance, Holden confronts Lily and Keith about Keith's debts and the gunman looking for him, but Lily defends Keith.

J.R. is desperate to find information about his missing mother, Dixie. He and Babe visit Alfred, a banker who has information about Dixie's account activity. Alfred is reluctant to share the information, but Babe is able to persuade him by appealing to his sense of compassion and his relationship with his own mother. Meanwhile, Tad and Aidan are also searching for Dixie and uncover a possible connection between her disappearance and Garret Williams, Mimi's husband. Tad and Aidan speak to Mimi, who is uncooperative and defensive of her husband. Tad and Aidan find a parking voucher from the yacht club dated the same day as Mimi's wedding and Dixie's disappearance, further suggesting a connection between Dixie and Garret. In a separate storyline, Greenlee visits Erin, Ryan's sister, in an attempt to connect with Ryan through her. Greenlee brings photos and mementos of Ryan to share with Erin, but the visit takes a turn when Erin begins to question whether Ryan was abusive like their father. Greenlee becomes defensive and the visit ends on a tense note.

Casey, Emily, Barbara, Alison, and Paul are trying to get Mick to release them from the church where he is holding them hostage. Mick wants to play a game of "truth or dare" and forces Emily to reveal that she had her tubes tied because she was scared of becoming pregnant. Mick then implies that Alison slept with him, which she denies. Mick shoots Paul, and Margo, Tom, and other police officers arrive at the scene. Mick takes Alison and Casey hostage in a separate room and continues to play his games with them. Alison eventually admits to Casey that she did sleep with Mick, and Casey is devastated. Tom and Margo discuss the situation and try to come up with a plan to rescue the hostages.

Erica is excited about a new space for her magazine, but Bianca is preoccupied with J.R.'s claim that Babe wrote in her letter that Bess is Miranda. David warns Erica that if Bianca finds out Miranda is alive, J.R. and Jamie could be charged with murder and kidnapping. Anita, a patient of Maria's, is startled when she sees a dead body. Aidan accuses Ethan of hiring a gunman to shoot Ryan, but Ethan denies it. Ryan confronts Zach with evidence that he shot at him. Jonathan tries to calm down Greenlee, who believes Kendall shot Ryan. J.R. asks Tad to help him deprogram Jamie, who is under Babe's influence. Tad suspects J.R. doesn't want Jamie back because he doesn't want Babe back. Bianca is upset that J.R. lied to her about Babe saying Bess is Miranda. Erica tells Bianca that the DNA test proves Bess is not Miranda. Maria tells Zach that Ethan tried to escape from jail. Kendall tells Ethan that Greenlee tried to kill her. Greenlee is hysterical because she thinks Ryan is dead.

Gwen and Will introduce their new baby, Hallie, to Casey. Casey feels guilty for not being there for Gwen and the baby when they needed him. He is also feeling overwhelmed and unsure about his future now that he is out of jail. Will and Gwen offer to help him find a job. Later, Casey tries to avoid talking to Maddie, but Gwen encourages him to reach out to her. Meanwhile, Katie takes care of Brad after his surgery, but she becomes frustrated with his lack of independence. Brad asks Katie to wash him, and she reluctantly agrees. Later, Katie helps Brad learn to use his crutches, and they continue to bicker. At the hospital, Carly is upset to learn that Rosanna has been taken back to Switzerland for treatment. Jack reassures Carly that they will get through this difficult time together. Sam confronts Carly about her relationship with Jack, and Cowboy Jack encourages Sam to get rid of Parker if he wants a chance with Carly. Dr. Seidman suggests family therapy as a way to help Parker work through his issues. Carly and Jack are hesitant, but they agree to give it a try.

Casey Hughes is getting married to Alison Stewart the next day, and he is nervous but excited. Mick Dante, a patient at the hospital, has escaped and Alison is worried for her family's safety. It is revealed that Mick Dante is being controlled by the thoughts of James Stenbeck, who is dead. Alison tries to convince Mick that he is still in control and can fight off James' thoughts. Emily Stewart is also worried about Alison and reveals to Susan that Alison slept with Mick. Paul Ryan is looking for Mick with a gun, intending to kill him. Barbara Ryan believes that Mick is James Stenbeck, who has discovered a youth serum to reverse aging. Henry Coleman warns Barbara about Mick and tells her that he is not James. Mick tries to convince Alison to run away with him, but she refuses and tells him to turn himself in. Henry and Barbara plan to attend Casey and Alison's wedding together. Emily convinces Paul to give her the gun and not to kill Mick. Alison is still worried about Mick and tells Casey that she needs to go to the church. Mick is heard arguing with James Stenbeck in his head. In the preview for next week, Alison is seen talking to James and Jack Snyder is seen with Carly Tenney.

Emily is worried about Chris' strained relationship with his father, Bob, who is the chief of staff at Memorial Hospital where Chris now works. Kim, Chris' mother, is trying to help Chris and Bob find common ground regarding a research project that Chris is passionate about, but Bob is hesitant to support. Meanwhile, Carly and Jack are planning a small, intimate wedding, but Carly has her own ideas about what she wants the ceremony to be like, causing some tension between the couple.

Liam is upset that Steffy is late for their dinner and has not returned his calls. He decides to take Bill's jet and leave town. Steffy arrives and learns that Liam has left. Katie and Ivy discuss Quinn's reaction to Wyatt moving out and Katie mentions that she has been spending time with Eric. Quinn tells Ridge that she wants to maintain their new understanding and not reveal their indiscretion in San Francisco.

Carly is dealing with a brain tumor diagnosis and Parker is determined to find a way to save her life, even if it means using his trust fund to pay for an experimental treatment in Berlin. Meanwhile, Noah's father, Colonel Mayer, has a change of heart and accepts his son for who he is, leading to a dinner invitation at the Snyder farm. However, tensions arise when Sly shows up, looking for Dusty Donovan, and Colonel Mayer reveals that he knows him as the man he shot and left for dead.

Stephanie confronts Rick about his relationship with Steffy, warning him that it will end disastrously and urging him to end it to avoid regret. Meanwhile, Bridget, disguised as Madame X, meets with Jackie to discuss her new designer position and is hesitant about being interviewed by the press. Taylor is distraught to learn about Steffy's secret relationship with Rick and vows to take action.

Janet is looking for Liberty, who spent the night at Paul and Emily's place. Jack suggests that Janet call Liberty, but Janet is afraid of what it means if Liberty doesn't answer. Paul and Emily suggest that Liberty move in with them until she gives birth, which Janet strongly opposes. Meanwhile, Margo and Tom are preparing for Adam's hearing, where Maddie is set to testify. However, Maddie doesn't show up, causing a delay in the hearing. Casey is upset with Adam for putting their family through this ordeal and for turning Alison against him. Adam tries to make amends with Casey before leaving town, but Casey tells him to leave and never come back.

Bonnie left some items in Dusty's car, including what appears to be a piece of lingerie. Dusty plans to apologize to Meg for interfering in her decisions about Paul. Damian and Meg discuss the custody agreement Meg has made with Paul, which allows him more visitation time with their daughter Eliza. Rosanna is staying with Paul temporarily while she looks for a job and her own place. Dusty advises Bonnie to keep track of her underwear, and Bonnie advises Dusty to use flowers when apologizing. Paul suspects that Rosanna is pretending to be content with a simpler life in order to get her money back from Craig. Rosanna tells Paul she doesn't want the money back and doesn't want to fight Craig. Meg tells Dusty that she has allowed Paul more visitation time with Eliza, and Dusty accuses her of being crazy. Craig asks Rosanna for a temporary truce for Carly's sake, but Rosanna refuses to approve of him seeing Carly. Carly tells Rosanna that Craig is the only person who doesn't make her feel like a loser. Paul snoops on Craig's laptop and finds information about his financial dealings.

Lily, Holden, and others are trying to rescue Ethan, who has fallen into a hole on the Snyder farm. Paul is also trapped in the hole while trying to rescue Ethan. Mike, the chief of the rescue squad, is working to get Paul and Ethan out, but they are having difficulty finding a way to anchor the rig to support Paul's weight. Meg is worried about Paul and is determined to stay at the site until he is rescued. Barbara, Paul's mother, is also present and is concerned about her son's safety. Meanwhile, Henry, Vienna, and Bonnie are being held captive by Derek, who is working for James Stenbeck. Henry is able to free them, and they learn that James is back in town and is responsible for their kidnapping. James is holding Meg captive and is forcing her to sign a document giving him custody of her unborn child in exchange for Paul's life. Paul is furious when he learns of this and vows to kill James.

Steffy and Hope have a disagreement about Liam's feelings and Steffy's intentions with Rick. Hope and Liam discuss their frustrations with the situation and Steffy's refusal to let go. At a dinner with their parents, Brooke and Katie discuss their children's relationships and the six-month waiting period for Liam and Hope's marriage.

Kim, a reality show producer, wants Katie and Brad to come to the studio to tape a segment about their efforts to get pregnant. Kim's request is last-minute, but Brad and Katie agree to go. Kim wants to include Henry and Vienna in the segment, but Henry is hesitant. He doesn't want to be part of a "reality TV circus" and is still grieving the loss of his and Vienna's own baby. Vienna, however, feels that it is important to support Katie and Brad. Meanwhile, Paul and Rosanna are on the run with Meg's baby. They stop at a diner, where they pretend to be a couple in need of food and money for their baby. The diner owner takes pity on them and gives them food and money. Later, Paul and Rosanna's car breaks down, and they are forced to push it to a nearby garage. They hitch a ride with a truck driver and continue their journey. Back at the studio, Kim begins taping the segment with Katie, Brad, and Vienna. However, the taping is interrupted when Katie faints. She is taken to the hospital, where the doctor informs her that she has elevated blood pressure and may have preeclampsia. The doctor tells Katie that she needs to go on bed rest for the remainder of her pregnancy. Brad and Vienna are worried about Katie, but she is determined to do whatever it takes to ensure the health of her baby.

Bill is proud of Liam for settling down with Steffy and starting a family. Eric offers his support to Brooke, who is upset about something but not ready to talk about it. Liam and Steffy look forward to their first barbecue as a married couple, but traffic is preventing Steffy from getting home. Hope tells Steffy that she is not running from her, and she will work through her negative feelings. The text also includes song lyrics from Hinder's "Born to be Wild."

Sally and Wyatt discuss Wyatt's desire to return to work at Spencer Publications, which his father, Bill, has offered. Wyatt wants to use the opportunity to help his father make things right with Sally, who was negatively affected by Bill's actions in the past. Specifically, Wyatt proposes resurrecting Spectra Fashions, Sally's former company that Bill destroyed. Sally is hesitant, as she is currently designing for Forrester Creations and is happy there. Meanwhile, Katie is dealing with the aftermath of Thorne leaving her and their family. Donna tries to console her, and Bill checks in on Katie and Will. Bill also speaks with Wyatt, who makes it clear that he will only return to Spencer Publications if Sally is a part of the deal. In a separate conversation, Justin asks Donna for help with a matter involving Bill and Katie.

Beth, the mother of Donna, Katie, and Brooke, is dealing with memory problems and is considering moving back to Paris to avoid being a burden on her family. Her daughters are trying to convince her to stay and help her remember the past by recreating positive family memories. Meanwhile, Marcus, Donna's son, is getting used to his new family at Forrester Creations and is trying to navigate his relationship with Steffy and her father, who is not accepting of Donna's new family.

Nicole is getting ready for her wedding to Zende, with her mom Vivienne, sister Maya, and friend Sasha helping her. Julius, Nicole's father, arrives and is emotional about his daughter getting married. The Forrester family is also preparing for the wedding, with Eric and Quinn hosting the event at their home. Julius is surprised to see the portrait of his other daughter, Amber, removed from its usual spot and replaced with a picture of Nicole. Sally Spectra and her grandmother Shirley are trying to find a way to crash the wedding for exposure for their fashion line. Zende is anxious about the wedding, but his parents Tony and Kristen reassure him. Pam and Charlie, the caterers, are confused when Sally and Shirley introduce themselves as caterers. Sasha, who was invited by Nicole, arrives and has a heart-to-heart with her sister. Julius gives Zende his blessing and reminds him to take care of Nicole. Nicole is emotional as she gets ready to walk down the aisle, with Steffy giving her advice and Sasha having a moment alone with her. Carter, the officiant, begins the ceremony and expresses gratitude for being able to celebrate Zende and Nicole's love on Valentine's Day.

Steffy and Liam are preparing to leave for their wedding in Australia, while Eric and Quinn are also attending the wedding as a married couple. Ridge and Brooke are on the same flight, excited for their upcoming wedding. Thomas is going to his sister's wedding alone, but he invites Sally as his date, which she can't accept due to financial constraints. However, Sally later decides to book a last-minute flight to Sydney after receiving encouragement from Shirley. Ivy is also on the flight, looking forward to showing everyone around Australia. Meanwhile, Bill is seated next to Katie, who notices him looking at Quinn. Back at the Forrester mansion, R.J. is left behind, taking care of Will and looking forward to his parents getting married. The flight takes off, with everyone excited for Steffy and Liam's wedding in Sydney. However, the drama is not over yet, as Nicole reveals a shocking secret to Maya, and Steffy confronts Quinn for her manipulations.

Brooke and Liam are at the hospital, waiting for news about Katie's health. Katie is in heart failure, and it is unclear what caused it. Donna suspects that Brooke and Bill are responsible for Katie's condition, as Katie had an episode after finding out that Bill spent the night at Brooke's house. Taylor is also at the hospital, as she has a follow-up appointment with Katie. It is revealed that Katie is not there, and no one knows where she is. It is later revealed that Katie is at the hospital, and she is in very bad shape. The doctors are unsure if she will survive. Taylor believes that Katie's health crisis is related to the stress caused by Brooke and Bill's relationship. Taylor also suspects that Bill was in an accident, as he has a bump on his head, but Bill denies this and tells Taylor that he will find out the truth.

Ridge and Rick are discussing a business deal regarding a corner store in a changing neighborhood. Ridge wants to use tactics to lower the price, but Rick is hesitant due to the long-time owners. Ridge compares it to when he got Rick to leave the Forrester house so he could move in with Caroline. Rick confronts Ridge about manipulating him and his father using Stephanie's portrait. Thomas is talking to Caroline about his desire to be a part of his soon-to-be-born brother's life and how he wants to improve his relationship with their father. Caroline goes into labor and Ridge leaves the office to be with her. Rick informs Eric about the situation and Eric expresses his excitement about a new Forrester baby. Rick and Eric argue about Ridge's controlling behavior and Rick's feelings of being pushed out of the family. Caroline is in active labor and Ridge, Thomas, a doula, and a midwife are present. Eric tries to focus on the positive aspects of the new baby and becoming a grandfather again. Caroline is dilated six centimeters and the baby's heartbeat is strong. Ridge and Caroline express their love for each other and their excitement for the baby.

Brooke and Nick are stuck on Nick's boat due to fog, discussing their situation and getting to know each other better. Nick reveals he wants five daughters in the future. Macy and Deacon are also on a boat, discussing their relationship and the possibility of marriage. Deacon proposes to Macy, who is hesitant due to their short time together and her recent divorce. Rick is trying to convince Sally that Deacon is a bad influence on Macy and that she should stay away from him. Rick and Sally argue about Macy's involvement with Deacon and the Forrester family's disapproval. Back on Nick's boat, Brooke and Nick share their life stories and reveal their desires for the future. They discuss their similarities and the possibility of a connection between them.

Donna's wedding to Thorne is interrupted when Thorne expresses doubts and ultimately decides he can't go through with it, leading to the cancellation of the wedding. It is revealed that Donna only married Thorne to get back at his mother Stephanie, but Katie told Thorne the truth before the wedding could be completed. Donna is upset and threatens to get revenge on Stephanie, who tells Donna to leave the property and warns that no one in the family will be taken in by her again.

Donna is replacing Brooke as the spokesmodel for Brooke's bedroom clothing line, which upsets Ridge as he was inspired by Brooke for the line. Bridget is not pregnant, which disappoints Dante but relieves Bridget as they are not married yet. Donna will be the new face of Brooke's bedroom, and Ridge has decided to stop designing for the line. Felicia confronts Dante about Bridget not being pregnant, and they discuss their past relationship. Nick and Brooke discuss the changes in their lives, and Donna tries to convince Ridge to continue designing for Brooke's bedroom.

Steffy and Liam observe that Bill is quiet during a visit with Kelly and Beth. Liam expresses his desire to spend more time with his daughters, and Steffy empathizes with the difficulty of being apart from them. Thomas announces to Hope, Douglas, and Zoe that he and Zoe will be getting married in a day or so. Douglas is upset by this news, and Hope tries to comfort him. Thomas explains to Vinny that he told Douglas and Hope about the wedding, and they were not happy about it. Thomas shows Zoe two wedding gowns he has designed, one for her and one for Hope. Hope is worried about Douglas and upset with Thomas for rushing the wedding. Carter is helping Zoe with some release forms and mentions to her that he is surprised by Thomas's engagement to her. Zoe mentions to Carter that Thomas wants to get married right away, and Carter assures her that Douglas will come around. Hope goes to check on Douglas, who is still upset about the wedding news. Steffy confronts Thomas about his plans to marry Zoe quickly, and Thomas defends his decision. Steffy accuses Thomas of manipulating Hope and trying to get her to marry him instead. Liam talks to Hope about the situation, and they agree that Thomas is trying to manipulate them. Thomas insists to Steffy that he is not trying to manipulate Hope and that the wedding gown is just for work. Steffy accuses Thomas of hoping that Hope will wear the gown to marry him.

Nick asks Brooke to let Storm represent them in their custody battle with Taylor over Jack. Nick has been trying to protect Taylor by not revealing her drinking problem, but now that she's alone with Jack, he's worried. Brooke is scared that Jack could be in danger. Taylor reports that Jack is sleeping peacefully after she sang to him. Rick finds it ironic that he is supporting Taylor against Brooke. Phoebe is concerned about her mother's mental health and Ridge thinks she's just going through a tough time. Nick confides in Storm that Taylor has been drinking again and he's worried about her instability. Storm is surprised because Taylor has had a tough time the last two years, but he thought she had gotten herself together. Nick wants to know how to protect himself, Taylor, and Jack in this situation. Taylor tells Rick she has proven herself ready to care for Jack and asks him to check the house for alcohol. Taylor is frustrated that Nick is so concerned about her caring for Jack on her own. Rick admires Taylor's desire to be a mother to Jack but wonders if it's her place in life. Felicia wants to plan an emotional anniversary party for Ridge and Taylor's parents to keep Ridge from leaving after. Ridge is committed to Donna but Felicia isn't ready to give up on her parents' marriage. Storm agrees to arrange an emergency hearing for custody of Jack. Nick is worried about dragging Taylor through the mud, but Storm says they need to prove Taylor's instability. Taylor receives the summons to appear in court the next morning. Brooke sympathizes with Taylor's pain of potentially losing custody of her child.

Bridget has told Nick that she is pregnant with his child, and they are discussing how to break the news to Brooke. Shane, a man who knows about Taylor's role in Darla's death, has been staying with Taylor and Hector, causing tension and concern. Nick and Brooke have decided not to have children, but Jackie is hopeful that they will change their minds.

Felicia is upset with Nick for telling her mother about her supposed drug habit. Eric and Stephanie are discussing a serious matter regarding Felicia, who might have a drug problem. Felicia is staying with Ridge and Brooke, and they are having a casual conversation about her returning to work. Thorne is about to be removed from Forrester Creations, and Darla is trying to help him by talking to Eric and Stephanie. There is tension between Ridge and Thorne, and Ridge wants Felicia to talk to Thomas about a mystery girl he has been seeing. Eric calls Thorne and asks him to come to the house with Darla for a meeting regarding his position at the company. Ridge and Brooke are confident that Eric will vote Thorne out of the company, but they are unaware of Eric's true intentions.

Flo, played by Katrina Bowden, is revealed to be the kidney donor for Katie, Brooke's sister, causing shock and confusion among the group. The conversation then shifts to Wyatt's engagement to Sally and his past relationship with Flo, with Wyatt reassuring Sally of his commitment to her.

Deacon apologizes to Hope for missing her wedding and explains that he knows about her marriage not working out with Liam. Hope tells Deacon that Liam found the note Deacon left her and thought she had left him, causing Liam to turn to Steffy. Bill talks to Liam about how he should move on from Hope and focus on business. Rick and Thomas discuss a new direction for Hope for the Future and Thomas leaves for a meeting. Deacon and Hope discuss the outside forces that affected their relationship, mainly Steffy, and Deacon expresses his desire to protect Hope.

Donna has returned from Paris to find that her husband, Eric, has come out of his coma. However, she finds herself barred from the house and her husband by Eric's family, who are protective of him as he recovers. Donna explains to Brooke that she and her assistant, Owen, were in a guest room together when Eric saw them, and he misunderstood the situation as them being unfaithful. Donna wants to explain what happened to Eric, but his family, led by Stephanie, won't let her. Donna is desperate to see Eric, but Stephanie insists that he doesn't want to see Donna and that she should move on with Owen instead. Meanwhile, Taylor is having trouble putting her baby Jack to sleep, and she is worried that she will lose custody of him again.

Bill advises Liam to call off his engagement with Hope, but Liam is hesitant. Hope has broken a promise to Liam regarding their wedding date, but she plans to explain everything to him. Liam's friends, including Marcus and Justin, give him advice about his upcoming marriage, suggesting that he should not question Hope's decisions. Bill asks Steffy to intervene and help end Liam and Hope's engagement. Steffy goes to Liam and offers to drive him home, and Bill gives her the keys to Liam's car. Liam is upset with his father for interfering, but Steffy is there for him and offers her support. Ridge and Brooke are happy that Hope was not able to move up the wedding date, and Justin is proud of Bill for throwing a party for Liam and reconsidering his stance on Hope.

Quinn Forrester is concerned about her son Wyatt's relationship with Katie Logan. Quinn's husband, Eric, gets mad when she expresses her concerns and walks out. Quinn's back is hurting after a physical altercation with Katie. Sheila Carter, a former enemy of the Forrester family, is now working as a waitress near Forrester Creations. Pam Douglas is skeptical of Sheila's presence and confronts her. Quinn and Eric get into a heated argument after Eric finds out about the altercation between Quinn and Katie. Mateo, a masseuse, treats Quinn's back pain and listens to her worries.

Thorne is surprised by his parents' support and recognition of his work. Eric gives Thorne the Spectra Couture collection as a gift and asks him to return to Forrester. Thorne is unsure about Ridge's reaction to this. Stephanie and Eric express their love for Thorne and are happy that he knows it now. Stephanie has to leave for work, and Eric stays behind to do damage control. Amber and Thomas are happy to have some time alone together. Caitlin informs Stephanie about Amber working at Insomnia, a place Thomas frequently visits. Stephanie reassures Caitlin that she will handle the situation. Darla and Thorne discuss the recent changes in Thorne's relationship with his parents. Thorne is unsure about returning to Forrester, despite his parents' wishes. Ridge and Brooke have a heartfelt goodbye as he prepares to leave town for work. Thomas brings Amber food, and Stephanie confronts Amber about her meeting with Thomas.

Ridge is concerned about Thomas' disappearance and wonders if he should sound an alarm. Steffy reveals that Douglas was dropped off at school, but they don't know who brought him. Hope wants to tell Ridge the truth about Thomas' death, but Brooke convinces her to stay quiet, emphasizing that all evidence has been destroyed. Ridge criticizes Thomas' obsession with Hope and wonders if it will be the death of him. Hope regrets her actions and struggles with the idea of telling Douglas and Liam about Thomas' death. Thomas appears, surprising Hope, who thought he was dead.

Thomas enlists Brooke's help for a publicity stunt to promote his new men's line at Forrester Creations. Taylor is worried about Thomas feeling overshadowed by Hope's successful line and urges Whip to advise Thomas to make a big statement. Whip believes Thomas needs to do something dramatic to get the press' attention. Meanwhile, Hope is relieved to find out Oliver still has his job at Forrester Creations. Oliver expresses his love for Hope and hopes they will be together in the future. At the fashion show, Thomas introduces his new line and expresses his gratitude for Brooke's input. Despite some technical difficulties, the show goes on, and Thomas' line receives a positive reception.

Rick, president of a fashion company, is concerned about a new design from his wife Caroline and her partner Ridge. He doesn't like the design, but Maya, an employee, thinks there might be more to Caroline and Ridge's relationship. Ridge and Caroline are saying goodbye to their design partnership, with Caroline expressing happiness for Ridge's return to design. Hope and Wyatt discuss their parents' relationship; Hope is worried about her father Deacon's involvement with Wyatt's mother Quinn, but Wyatt thinks they should focus on their own family. Maya warns Rick about Caroline and Ridge, telling him she saw them in an intimate embrace. Rick dismisses Maya's concerns, but she thinks Caroline doesn't appreciate Rick. Deacon is torn between his relationship with Quinn and his daughter Hope, who has given him an ultimatum to choose between them.

Ridge helped Will, Katie's son, have a chance for a better life by getting the judge to rule in Katie's favor regarding custody. Bill thanks Ridge for helping him see Will more often, but Ridge denies bribing the judge. Instead, Ridge says he was protecting a little boy. Bill, however, suspects Ridge paid off the judge to rule in Katie's favor. Bill also thanks Brooke for helping him with the custody situation. Brooke tells Ridge about running into Bill at a restaurant, who wanted to thank her for helping him see Will more often. Bill also told Brooke that Katie can see things more clearly now because Brooke discussed the custody situation with her. Ridge becomes upset, thinking Bill is going after Brooke. Brooke tells Ridge she doesn't care about Bill and to stop talking like that. Meanwhile, Pam and Charlie are getting married, and Pam wants to get married in Eric's living room, under Stephanie's portrait. Quinn, however, is hesitant to take down her portrait.

Bill Spencer is in the hospital and Ridge Forrester visits him. Bill brings up how Ridge pushed him off a balcony, but Ridge doesn't want to talk about it. Bill says he's trying to change his life and practice forgiveness, but Ridge thinks he's just trying to get to Brooke. Eric Forrester and Brooke are discussing Bill's condition and Eric expresses his skepticism about Bill's ability to change. Pam is arguing with Quinn about having her wedding at the Forrester house and the portrait of Stephanie Forrester. Brooke and Eric continue their conversation about Bill and Eric warns Brooke about getting caught between Bill and Ridge again. The scene shifts back to Bill and Ridge, where Ridge accuses Bill of being more committed to his own greed than to any relationship. Justin arrives to take Bill home and Ridge warns Bill to stay away from his wife.

Jake, a pilot, is waiting for Massimo, Nick, and Ridge to board a plane in Puerto Vista. Massimo and Nick are waiting for Brooke and her daughter, Bridget, to arrive. Nick is worried about his other daughter, Brooke, who has gone off alone after her husband's death. Meanwhile, Sally is complaining about department stores advertising Christmas before Halloween. Ridge, who was thought to be dead, appears and reunites with his family. Deacon asks Amber to leave his home so that his son, Eric, will not be confused by her presence. Amber is upset because she feels that she is being pushed out of her son's life again. Bridget tries to calm Amber down, but Amber accuses Bridget of meddling in her life. Ridge is grateful to Jake, Nick, and Brooke for saving his life and returning his $10 million in gold. Stephanie has arrived to join them on the plane, and she is happy to see Brooke and Ridge together.

Ridge and Brooke are discussing the possibility of including Jack, Taylor's son who has Brooke's DNA due to a fertility lab mix-up, in their family. Ridge is hesitant and worried about the complications it could bring, while Brooke believes that it could bring their families closer together. Meanwhile, Felicia and Ashley are discussing the situation and are skeptical that Brooke will be able to deny her maternal feelings for Jack. Taylor has decided to return to work as a psychiatrist, and Nick is surprised that she wants to do so soon after giving birth.

Stephanie, a shooting victim, accuses Donna of the crime. Donna denies it and claims Stephanie is confused due to painkillers. Eric, Stephanie's husband, asks Donna to explain what happened. Donna insists she didn't shoot Stephanie and was down the hall when the incident occurred. Ridge and Brooke discuss the situation, with Ridge believing someone from Brooke's family is responsible. Eric comes home to find Pam, his sister-in-law, who offers him a home-cooked meal. Donna confronts Stephanie in the hospital, accusing her of stealing the spotlight and being unhappy. Brooke and Ridge consider postponing their wedding due to family tensions.

Stephanie is at Brooke's house, taking off a ring and giving it to Brooke, saying that she wants her to have it. Eric, Hope, Rick, and Pam are discussing a tribute video they made for Stephanie and whether or not they should show it to her. Katie is experiencing postpartum depression and feels like she is dying. Taylor is trying to help her through it. Thorne and Felicia have a conversation about their relationship and how it has evolved over the years. Stephanie is nearing the end of her life and Brooke is taking care of her. Katie is worried that her son won't want her because she has had trouble breastfeeding him. Donna, Rick, Marcus, and Steffy are all saying goodbye to Stephanie and thanking her for the impact she has had on their lives. Brooke reads Stephanie a story and Stephanie falls asleep. Pam reflects on her relationship with Stephanie and how she will always look to her for guidance. Eric reflects on his relationship with Stephanie and how much he has loved and despised her over the years. Stephanie falls asleep and Brooke sings to her.

Taylor is happy to see her daughter Phoebe return home after a long tour. Phoebe is unsure about moving back home permanently, as she has been busy promoting her fragrance and touring with her boyfriend Constantine. Taylor and Phoebe discuss the pain caused by Taylor's relationship with Phoebe's first love, Rick. Phoebe's brother Rick is upset about his mother Brooke's upcoming wedding to Ridge. Brooke wants Rick to attend the rehearsal dinner and support their relationship, but Rick refuses. Phoebe returns home and reunites with her father Ridge, who is happy to have her back. Phoebe has written a song for Ridge and plans to sing it at his rehearsal dinner. Taylor and Ridge discuss the upcoming wedding and Taylor's hopes for a stable family. Ridge agrees to spend time with Taylor and the family, but Taylor decides not to attend the wedding. Brooke tries to convince Rick to support her relationship with Ridge, but Rick refuses. Brooke and Ridge are committed to their relationship and are ready to start their new life together.

Thorne confesses to Brooke that he has wanted to kiss her for a long time, and Brooke reveals that she has always admired Thorne's qualities. Thorne proposes the idea of giving their relationship another try, and Brooke doesn't dismiss it. Ridge offers to guide R.J. In his career and expresses his desire to recreate the relationship he had with his father through his son. Ridge is not happy about Thorne's return and accuses him of trying to start trouble between Ridge and Brooke. Ivy asks Simon for his opinion on which engagement ring she should choose, and Simon ends up proposing to her with one of the rings. Maya and Nicole reflect on how much their lives have changed and express their excitement about their experiences. Maya tells Nicole that she saw Brooke and Thorne looking intimate, and Nicole wonders if something is going on between them. Ridge chooses the engagement ring designed by Quinn, and Brooke encourages him to work on his relationship with Thorne. Thorne expresses his feelings to Brooke and asks her to reconsider marrying Ridge, revealing that he made a mistake by letting her go in the past. Maya and Nicole discuss the possibility of Thorne making a play for Brooke and the potential impact on the family. Ridge tells Quinn that Thorne knows about their past relationship and has been telling Brooke about it, causing Brooke to reconsider her decision to marry Ridge. Thorne confesses his love for Brooke and asks her to marry him instead.

EJ and Sami discuss business matters and their strained relationship. Nick tries to make amends with Abigail, but she is uncomfortable and leaves. Theresa cons a store employee into giving her gift cards for her personal use.

Max is overwhelmed with taking care of Abby's car while she's at college and dealing with Mimi's family drama, causing him to feel like he's lost control of his life. Abby apologizes to Max for being jealous of his relationship with Mimi in the past, and encourages him to start racing again to find fulfillment.

Melanie's father is leaving town due to his health condition, causing Melanie distress; Chad's father, Stefano, offers to help Chad with his coffeehouse venture, but Chad declines, wanting to do it on his own. Hope and Bo use Stefano's interest in a safe deposit box shared with Hope's grandmother to their advantage in their investigation.

Lexie and Tek are having an affair, but Lexie feels guilty and wants to end it. Abe is struggling with his poor night vision and thinks he saw Lexie with someone, but she covers it up. Marlena still loves John and wants them to be together, but John is focused on his plan for revenge against Alex. Mimi writes a letter to Shawn revealing the truth about Claire's paternity, which will drastically change their lives.

Dr. Jonas is treating Chelsea, who has had a complication from surgery. Her temperature is 101.3 and blood pressure is 80/50. Kate, Chelsea's grandmother, is concerned and wants answers from Dr. Jonas. Daniel is hesitant to speculate until he has all the facts from the tests. E.J. is working for Nicole, which Sami disapproves of. Sami threatens to reveal to an immigration officer that E.J. hit their son Johnny, if E.J. doesn't drop Nicole as a client.

Nicole asks Brady to help her stall Mia, who wants to meet Nicole's fiancé. Brady suggests that Nicole tell Mia the truth instead. Mia shows up and asks to meet Nicole's fiancé, but Nicole says he is out of the country on business. Mia insists on meeting him before she gives up her baby for adoption. Charlotte and John discuss his therapy sessions. Chelsea invites Max to the Horton engagement party as her date, but he gets the impression that she is not interested in him. Kate tells Lucas and Daniel that she and Daniel are no longer seeing each other. Lucas is upset and punches Daniel.

Nicole suspects EJ and Stefano of keeping Rafe captive in their basement and plans to prove it with a DNA report. EJ decides to divorce Nicole for Taylor, but Taylor is uncomfortable with the idea. Stefano wants Chad to work at DiMera Enterprises instead of the hospital. Rafe is revealed to be an imposter, and Bo asks him to give an official statement about finding Theo and Ciara.

Carly wakes up buried underground, held captive by Vivian, who blames her for Lawrence's death. Victor dismisses Hope's concerns about Vivian being a threat to Melanie. Maggie decides not to attend Melanie's wedding out of respect for her late husband, Mickey. Chloe reveals to Daniel that she's pregnant with his baby. Vivian has a surprise for Melanie on her wedding day. Nathan and Stephanie prepare for their vacation together. Carly manages to contact Bo for help, and he rushes to the cannery building where she's being held. Meanwhile, Vivian's plan for Melanie's wedding day unfolds.

Marlena is upset with John for putting a bug-sweeping device in her purse, which she received from Roman. John says he did it to protect her from Tony, but Marlena believes it's to control her. They discuss the impact of the revelation that Tony and Anna are Rex and Cassie's parents. Shawn and Belle talk about their relationship and the possibility of abstinence until marriage. Kate and Roman argue about her relationship with Tony. Rex meets with his former professor, Rolf, who reveals that he and Stefano created Rex and Cassie as part of an experiment for human perfection. Rex is intrigued and wants to know more about his project, while Rolf is proud of his creation.

Adrienne brings Alex's guitar picks to Jennifer for JJ. Jennifer is worried about Abigail who is having a tough time with the DiMeras. Adrienne reveals to Jennifer that she saw Abigail with EJ. Abigail is texting with Nick's cousin Julie who is concerned about Nick. Gabi is making churros for EJ to thank him for helping her. Sami and EJ discuss how EJ helped with the situation between Gabi and Abigail. Jennifer knows about Abigail and EJ's friendship and warns Abigail to stay away from him. EJ receives a special delivery from Gabi and takes a call while Gabi leaves. Abigail calls EJ to warn him that Jennifer knows about their friendship.

Rex and Mimi have a serious conversation about their relationship, with Mimi revealing a past abortion and lying to Rex about helping Belle and Shawn. Jan overhears and threatens to reveal Mimi's secret if she doesn't stop Belle from telling Philip the truth about her feelings for Shawn. Belle struggles with her decision to end her marriage by email, while Shawn-d insists it's the right thing to do. Kate and Eugenia plot against Sami, with Kate revealing she hired a private investigator to follow her and Eugenia planting a false horoscope on a website Sami frequents. Sami, under the influence of a drug, confesses her fears about her wedding day and horoscope to an unconscious Brandon.
Hope and Aiden plan a getaway to the Green Mountain Lodge to figure out their relationship;

Jack has returned from the dead and is reunited with his family. He and Abby celebrate her 17th birthday with cake. Jennifer is overjoyed to have her husband back and Hope is happy for her friend. Bo and Billie search for their daughter Georgia, following a clue they received. They find a sign that Georgia may be in trouble and continue to search for more clues. Meanwhile, Kate and John are also back from the dead, much to Marlena and Roman's surprise. Roman and Kate, as well as John and Marlena, have a lot to explain to each other.

Maxine mentions that Jennifer has been late for work and detained, possibly due to public displays of affection with Daniel, which Anne takes issue with. Anne, still employed in H.R., plans to enforce codes of conduct and tells Jennifer to keep her hands off Daniel. Jennifer suspects Chloe put Anne up to this, but Anne denies it and says she's just doing her job.

John receives a call from Roman who is looking for Kate and asks for John's help. Kate is at the airport, preparing to go on a business trip. Lucas is at a club with a woman named Jewel when Tony and another business associate arrive. Belle calls Marlena, sounding shaken, and tells her that something happened at a party Cassie threw at the mansion. Marlena and John go to the mansion to check on Belle and find out that Vin Ramsell, a drug dealer, tried to poison Shawn.

Nick Fallon returns a grant meant for his alternative fuel source research because his friend Max manipulated and changed his final proposal without his knowledge or approval. Max admits to altering the calculations and equations in the proposal, but Dean Robbins believes it is not a significant impact on the work. Nick has an ethical issue with Max's actions and plans to review the changes before deciding whether to continue with the prototype. Max is upset that Nick is willing to throw away years of research because of his actions and calls him foolish.

Chloe considers telling Daniel about her infidelity to ensure he won't leave her after their wedding. Melanie confronts Chloe about her erratic behavior regarding the wedding. Daniel and Chloe prepare for a low-key wedding, while Maxine offers to help with the arrangements. Jennifer works on a scrapbook for her grandmother, who is ill. Kate discovers a mysterious package from Stefano DiMera. Philip and Lucas discuss Chloe's upcoming wedding to Daniel. Melanie and Chloe have a heart-to-heart conversation about their past relationships and Chloe gives Melanie advice about her future with Daniel.

Kate is surprised to see Lucas back in Salem so soon from Houston. She asks about his trip and his relationship with Sheryl, which Lucas says is over. Kate reveals she had a discussion with Jordan about her multiple identities, which led to Jordan leaving town. Rafe is upset that Jordan didn't tell him she was leaving and that Ben was the one to inform him. Ben asks Abigail about a terrible thing she did in the past, but she brushes him off. Will and Sonny discuss Nick's increasing threats towards Gabi and their daughter Ari. Sami and EJ discuss Nick's impending death, with EJ reassuring Sami that they did the right thing. Julie finds Nick injured and calls for help.

Paul is helping Sonny investigate Deimos, who may have chartered a plane. They hope to find out where he went and why. Sonny is hesitant to get involved because he doesn't want to antagonize Deimos further. Brady and Nicole are happily raising their family, but their peace is disrupted when Joey and Jade visit. Jade is moving out of the loft she shares with Joey, and she is sad about it. Steve and Kayla are hosting a dinner for their family, including Tripp, Steve's long-lost son. Tripp is struggling to come to terms with the fact that Steve's wife, Ava, was responsible for his mother's death. Meanwhile, Abigail has left Chad and is now dating Eli. Gabi, who has feelings for Chad, is upset about this and confronts Abigail. Sonny discovers that Deimos has gone to Manitoba, Canada, where Brady and Nicole are currently located. Sonny and Paul rush to Canada to protect them, but they are too late. Deimos has already arrived and shot Brady.
Marlena and Gabi tend to JJ, who has been shot and needs medical attention; Justin expresses concern for Adrienne's safety and the two reminisce about their past relationship.

Marlena is about to marry John, but Sami interrupts the ceremony, claiming that the bride is trying to kill her. Sami believes that Susan, who has been invited to the wedding, is an imposter who drugged her. Amidst the chaos, Susan reveals that she is Kristen DiMera, who has returned to Salem to seek revenge on Marlena for pushing her out of a tower window years ago. Kristen has taken hostages at the wedding and intends to kill Marlena on her wedding day. Will, who has been struggling with memory loss, starts to regain his memories and remembers his love for Sonny.

Jennifer's son, JJ, is working undercover for the DEA and his mother is covering for him. Eve, Paige's mother, tells Kyle, Paige's new boyfriend, about JJ's undercover work. Kyle then promotes JJ and asks him to sample some meth that is coming in. Will and Paul discuss their relationship and the impact it had on Will's marriage. Adrienne and Lucas discuss their relationship and the difficulties of moving on from past relationships. Justin helps Eve, who has had too much to drink, and they have a conversation getting to know each other. Serena tells Chad that she has to put the brakes on their relationship, but Chad doesn't want to stop.

Abe, Theo's father, agrees to perform the wedding ceremony for Sami and EJ at their request. Sami is grateful because her own family is not present, and she has few friends. She is estranged from her mother, Marlena, and her father, John, does not approve of EJ. Paige, a friend of Sami's son, Will, visits Jennifer, JJ's mother, to ask for JJ's help with a video game. Paige's mother, Eve, is a singer and travels frequently for work. She has been away for a year, and Paige is excited to see her again. Eve has heard good things about JJ from Paige and is eager to meet him. JJ is nervous about meeting Eve because he has a criminal record and is worried she will judge him. Jennifer assures him that Eve will see his good heart and that he has turned his life around. Eve is surprised to learn that JJ is Paige's boyfriend because she thought he was from a more sophisticated family.

Sami and Rafe are happy together and looking forward to spending New Year's Eve with their family. Meanwhile, Melanie and Philip are eloping to Las Vegas to get married. Nathan has other plans and tries to stop them, leading to a confrontation with Philip. Carly is trapped in a box by Vivian, who is seeking revenge for the death of her son.

Claire has been taking specimens to the lab, while Ciara has been reading to a sweet old lady who wanted her to read "Fifty Shades of Grey." Ciara's mom is in prison and only allows for four hours of visiting a month. Theo overheard Valerie lying to her boss about being in New York and confronts her about it, causing a scene. Sonny hired Paul, who is a private investigator, to help him with a situation involving his family business.

Gabi and Eli have a conversation about doughnuts and a fill-in dad for Gabi's daughter's school event. Rafe joins the conversation with a bruise on his face, and Eli mentions that he is early for work. Kate calls Jennifer to apologize for an article about her in the newspaper, and Jennifer asks Kate for a statement about recent deals falling through at Dimera Enterprises. Victor asks Eve to leave the Kiriakis mansion now that it has been confirmed that Will Horton is dead and Ben Weston murdered his daughter. Eve tells Victor that she is the new CEO of Basic Black, a company that Titan is obligated to pay 80% of the operating costs for.

Sonny, a mob boss, discovers that Detective Dominic Pirelli is his son, Dante Falconeri, and Dante is critically injured in a shooting. At Josslyn's christening party, Carly thanks Jax for his support, while Molly tries to convince Jason and Sam to get married.

Hope is worried about Ben Weston being around Ciara and wants Marlena to help her convince Ciara that Ben is a danger. Marlena reveals to Hope that she has been working with Ben in therapy and he has given her permission to discuss his treatment. Marlena believes that with medication and psychotherapy, Ben can lead a productive life. Chad is struggling with accepting Abigail's pregnancy with Stefan's baby and seeks Marlena's help. Abigail is determined to cut Stefan out of her life and focus on her pregnancy and family with Chad. Lani receives copies of her stillborn son's death certificate and struggles with her grief. JJ and Gabi discuss her recent interactions with Chad and JJ expresses his concern for her. JJ also updates Gabi on his own life and shares some words of wisdom with her. Tripp and Ciara deal with the aftermath of Ben showing up at her loft and Tripp expresses his disapproval of Ciara talking to Ben. Rafe and Hope discuss the investigation into the fire at Ciara's loft and the lack of evidence against Ben. Hope is frustrated with the lack of progress and Rafe suggests closing the case and encouraging Ben to leave town.

Victor is grieving the loss of his wife Caroline and is not taking it well. Kate confronts him about his behavior and brings up the possibility that Nicole Walker, a former enemy, is working with Xander Cook, another enemy, for some unknown purpose. Hope is looking for Ted Laurent, who has gone missing, and suspects that Nicole may know something about his disappearance. Nicole is still grieving the loss of her daughter Holly and blames Eric Brady for her death. She has told Eric that their relationship is over, but Eric is not convinced. Rex and Sarah are getting married, and Eric is performing the ceremony. Xander is holding Ted captive and plans to kill him, but Ted tries to bribe him with an expensive necklace and a deal for a free pass with the law. Victor is concerned about Maggie's mental health and her recent claim that she saw Kristen DiMera, who is supposed to be dead. Kate offers to sneak into Nicole's room and look for any evidence of wrongdoing. Brady tries to convince Nicole not to work for Stefan DiMera, but she is determined to help him turn the company around. Brady still has feelings for Nicole, but knows that it would be wrong to pursue a relationship with her while she is still grieving and while Eric still has feelings for her.

Will's dad is on his way to Salem because of his mom's surgery. Sonny offers to read to Ari so Will can stay and wait for news. Vivian calls the hospital to check on Kate's status and is frustrated to learn she's still in surgery. Jack suspects Eve destroyed Rolf's lab because she's angry and vindictive. Jennifer is grateful to Eve for bringing Jack back to Salem, despite everything she's done. Eve wants to help Stefan deal with the crisis at Dimera Enterprises now that Kate is out of commission. Jack is looking for Rolf to continue work on the serum to restore his memory. Kristen tries to seduce Brady, but he resists, reminding her of all the terrible things she's done. Xander tells Nicole he's signed divorce papers and is moving on with Sarah. Nicole is skeptical and warns Xander that he's to blame for many of the problems in her life. Eric and Sarah have a heartfelt conversation about their relationship and how it has enriched their lives.

Sami is reluctant to attend her mother's funeral, but Lucas and Will convince her to go. Belle is also emotional and feels guilty for not being there for her mother when she was alive. At the funeral, John speaks about Marlena's impact on people's lives and how she should be remembered. Celeste claims that Marlena's spirit is not at peace and that she has a message for John. Meanwhile, Jan is holding Shawn captive and Nicole tries to get money from her to bail out a friend from jail. Jan refuses to give Nicole the money, leading to a confrontation. Back at the funeral, Sami has a moment alone with her mother's casket and hears her mother's voice calling her name. She is shocked and confused by what she is experiencing.

<summary>
Sami is reluctant to attend her mother's funeral, but Lucas and Will convince her to go. Belle is also emotional and feels guilty for not being there for her mother when she was alive. At the funeral, John speaks about Marlena's impact on people's lives and how she should be remembered. Celeste claims that Marlena's spirit is not at peace and that she has a message for John. Meanwhile, Jan is holding Shawn captive and Nicole tries to get money from her to bail out a friend from jail. Jan refuses to give Nicole the money, leading to a confrontation. Back at the funeral, Sami has a moment alone with her mother's casket and hears her mother's voice calling her name. She is shocked and confused by what she is experiencing.
</summary>

Luke is visited by an old friend, Ernesto, who brings him a gift to help him recover from his medical procedure. Lucky and Elizabeth run into each other and discuss their New Year's Eves. Diane is excited to have been nominated for "Litigator of the Year" and Jerry tries to ask Alexis out as a witness to her success. Carly serves Alexis with an eviction notice for not paying rent on time, and Alexis apologizes and promises to pay. Jerry hires a man to kill Stanford Johnson, a former employee who knows too much about his business dealings.

Sheila, who works for Abe, mayor of Salem, apologizes for not coming to work due to food poisoning. Abe is upset because she didn't inform him and asks her to be more responsible in the future. Meanwhile, Paul, Abe's son, plans to move to San Francisco to join an experimental program that could help him walk again. He is motivated by the opportunity to be with his mother, whom he misses. Will, Abe's other son, is dealing with the aftermath of his breakup with Paul and Sonny's departure from Salem. Valerie, Abe's girlfriend, is offered a job as chief of staff at her old hospital in D.C. and wants Abe to consider moving with her, but he declines as he has made a promise to the community.

Sonny is holding Johnny captive in an abandoned psychiatric clinic in the mountains, hoping to get information about his missing son. Claudia, Johnny's sister, comes to Jason with a deal to bring down Trevor Lansing, a powerful figure in the Zacchara organization. Meanwhile, Nikolas Cassadine believes he has finally remembered who killed his fiancée, Emily, and it's Diego Alcazar.

Todd Manning, a dangerous fugitive, takes Sonny Corinthos hostage at gunpoint, seeking revenge for the death of his daughter and her boyfriend. Starr Manning, Todd's daughter, tries to stop him and reconcile with her father. The situation is resolved when John McBain, a detective from Llanview, arrives and arrests Todd.
Georgie regains consciousness and is able to see Maxie before she dies; Nikolas and Emily reconcile and make love, with Nikolas vowing to help Emily heal.

Nikolas ends his relationship with Rebecca due to his continued feelings for her twin sister, Emily, while Carly tries to give Michael space and independence as he deals with the aftermath of being shot. Meanwhile, Claudia schemes to have Jason killed and asks Johnny for his help in carrying out the plan.

Sonny gives water to Alexis, who is having breathing problems; Nikolas and Emily find Lucky drunk and he asks them to take care of Elizabeth and Cameron; Elizabeth goes to Jason's place after finding out about Lucky's affair; Ric and Sam argue about their one-night stand and its consequences.

Sonny and Carly visit Morgan's grave and discuss their issues. Ava is released from jail and wants to see Avery, leading to a confrontation with Carly. Olivia Jerome has Alexis captive and forces Julian to choose between them. Jordan is checked out by a doctor after the explosion, and Dante checks in with the station for updates on Olivia Jerome. Finn begins his leave of absence to deal with his addiction, and Hayden supports him. Sonny asks Curtis for help in finding Olivia Jerome. In a preview for the next episode, Carly tells Morgan she has found out who killed him, Sonny asks Curtis for help, Olivia Jerome talks about righting a wrong, Jordan and Andre express their feelings for each other, Lulu asks Kevin for help, and Jake has a mysterious message.

Elizabeth and Hayden have a confrontation with Hayden's estranged mother, Naomi. Franco reaches out to Elizabeth, offering his help in getting revenge on Hayden. Jason and Sam discuss the possibility that Nikolas faked his own death to escape legal troubles. Lucas regains consciousness and begins to remember the events leading up to his shooting. Nathan confesses to Maxie that he shot Claudette's lover in a jealous rage years ago. Jordan investigates Lucas' shooting and questions the hospital staff. Hayden and Naomi argue over the whereabouts of a valuable diamond necklace. Elizabeth and Franco bond over their shared dislike of Hayden. Naomi offers to help Hayden with her legal troubles in exchange for the diamond necklace. Maxie struggles to process Nathan's confession and takes some time apart from him to think.

Alexis thinks Sam should reconsider having a baby with Jason due to the dangerous nature of his work. Jason and Carly discuss Jax's attempts to gain full custody of Josslyn. Jax hires Alexis to help him with his custody case against Carly. Lisa kidnaps Robin and plans to kill her. Brenda is having trouble adjusting to being a mother and feels like an outsider in her own home. Sonny and Jason discuss the challenges of being a parent in their line of work. Michael confronts Kristina about her drug use and she admits to taking hydrocodone. Carly tries to convince Shawn to continue protecting Josslyn despite Jax's attempts to discredit him. Kristina begs Michael not to tell their mother about her drug use. Sonny contemplates leaving Brenda for the sake of her son's safety. Brenda thanks Carly for helping her son, Alec, and Carly expresses her belief that every child belongs with their mother. Lisa taunts Robin before leaving her to die in a gas-filled room.

Sonny and Carly's wedding day has arrived, but there are still some issues to be dealt with. Michael is struggling with his feelings towards Sonny, while Morgan is facing the possibility of being bipolar like his father. Meanwhile, Molly and TJ are trying to fix a mistake they made regarding the wedding cake. Carly is also worried about her son's absence from the wedding.

Sonny Corinthos has been shot and is being attended to by medics. Meanwhile, his wedding to Carly is about to start and the guests are waiting for him to arrive. Anna Devane is dealing with the fallout of Sloane's actions and the revelation that he has been working for Nikolas Cassadine.

Michael is angry that the man who attempted to rape Abby is out on bail, and he blames Dante for not preventing it. Sonny and Brenda discuss the loss of Jason's son Jake and how it has affected Jason. Dante and Lulu discuss the legal issues surrounding Jake's death and the suspects on the list. Luke feels responsible for Jake's death and Sonny tries to console him by saying it was an accident. Patrick brings home potstickers for dinner, and he and Robin reflect on the past and how life is short. Carly and Shawn discuss her issues with Brenda and Jax, and Carly talks about her daughter Josslyn's cancer. Michael confronts Dante about the man who attacked Abby being out on bail, and Dante says he will fix the problem. Suzanne surprises Theo with the news that their grandson is alive and on his way to them. Brenda and Sonny discuss Jason's grief and how Luke is shouldering the blame for Jake's death. Elizabeth blames herself for Jake's death and Luke tries to console her, admitting that he had a few drinks before driving the night of the accident.

Sam McCall has left a message for Dr. Finn to call her back about some test results that will affect her decisions. She is worried about passing malaria to her unborn child if Jason has it. Elizabeth reassures her that malaria is not passed from person to person like a cold or flu, but only in utero during pregnancy. Sam has not yet told Jason about the pregnancy. Laura and Kevin receive their test results and are relieved to find out they do not have malaria. Lucy visits Kevin in the hospital and they discuss their past relationship. Ava Jerome visits the hospital for her own malaria test and runs into Laura. They discuss their sons, Nikolas and Jason, and Ava tells Laura that Nikolas died a hero. Alexis Davis visits her ex-husband, Julian Jerome, in prison and asks him to speak to the Bar Association on her behalf to avoid being disbarred. She tries to appeal to his sense of decency and love for her, but he asks for something in return.

1. Lucky catches Johnny wearing a Clinton mask and trying to break into Bernie Abrams' office, but Johnny denies any involvement. 
2. Carly finds a picture of Franco in Josslyn's christening album and worries about his intentions towards her daughter.
3. Sonny has a meeting with Diane and Claire, where Claire reveals her plan to send him to prison with Dante's help.
4. Jason asks Spinelli to investigate a picture of Franco, hoping to track him down and handle their grudge match.
5. Maxie and Spinelli discuss the dangers of Johnny and Lucky's friendship, while Maxie expresses her concerns about their self-destructive tendencies.
6. Diane and Alexis share an office while Diane's office is being renovated, causing some tension between the two lawyers.
7. Sonny and Dante have a heated conversation about Sonny's trial and Dante's testimony, with Sonny expressing his unconditional love for his son.
8. Nikolas visits Alexis to discuss Elizabeth's reluctance to accept his help in setting up a trust for her unborn child.
9. Lucky tries to arrest Ethan for being in the United States without a green card, but Luke intervenes and defends his son.
10. Michael confronts Dante about his true intentions towards Sonny and their family, while Sonny interrupts their conversation and tells Dante to leave.

Tracy insists on joining Luke in his quest to find Jerry Jacks, who has the cure for Luke's polonium poisoning. Laura, Lulu, and Nikolas discuss Lulu's past trauma with Stavros Cassadine, who forced her to marry him and shot Nikolas to punish Lulu. Ava reveals to Carly that she knows Morgan well from his stay in New York and uses this knowledge to manipulate Carly into allowing Morgan to stay with her. Michael struggles with his attraction to his cousin Kiki and asks AJ for help. Elizabeth returns a necklace to Nikolas and mentions her issues with AJ, who slept with Carly. AJ tells Michael about his one-time encounter with Carly and how Elizabeth found out. Elizabeth confronts Nikolas about withholding information about her and AJ's relationship status when AJ slept with Carly. Lulu suspects that Luke might be sick and decides to confront him about his mysterious trips. Laura insists on joining Lulu, asserting that they are bonded as parents. Luke writes a note to Tracy, expressing his love but explaining that he must handle his situation alone.

Jerry has taken Alexis hostage on a boat and plans to escape with stolen money, leaving Port Charles and the antiserum behind. Sonny and Jax are determined to rescue Alexis and stop Jerry. Jerry reveals to Jax that he is dying from radiation sickness caused by a bullet laced with polonium-210. Tracy steals the only dose of antiserum to give to her dying father, Edward.

Sam and Silas discuss Silas's daughter, Kiki. Sam encourages Silas to consider what he wants in terms of a relationship with Kiki. Meanwhile, Carly arrives at Sonny's house with news about Franco's case. Tracy and Ava watch a television show featuring a report on Franco's case, and Ava fills Tracy in on the details. At the hospital, Brad and Felix discuss Brad's decision not to raise his child with Britt. Nikolas, Britt, and Sabrina deal with a medical emergency involving Britt's newborn baby. Kiki wants to see Franco, and Michael offers to give her a ride to the Quartermaines' house.

Sonny Corinthos's wedding to Kate Howard is interrupted multiple times, once by Olivia Falconeri who tries to reveal Kate's true identity as Connie, and later by Connie herself who reveals she is already married. It is revealed that Joe Scully Jr. has kidnapped Sonny's daughter, Kristina, and is holding her for ransom. Meanwhile, Jason Morgan learns that the baby Sam thought died is actually alive and being raised by Téa Delgado in Llanview.

1. Patrick struggles to change Jake's diaper, and Robin helps him out, noting that he's a brain surgeon and should find changing a diaper easy. 
2. Carly reassures Jax that she's not pregnant, but Jax wants her to take a pregnancy test to be sure. 
3. Sonny and Kate discuss getting a prenup, and Sonny is hesitant because he turned over his holdings to Jason when he took over the business.
4. Claudia takes care of Jason when he's sick, and Spinelli comes in, feeling peculiar. 
5. Maxie and Johnny are stuck in an elevator, and Maxie tries to flirt with Johnny, who is uninterested.
6. Lulu and Logan run into each other, and Logan warns Lulu about the Zaccharas, but Lulu insists she knows what she's doing.
7. Carly and Jax argue about taking a pregnancy test, and Carly is worried about what will happen if she can't have a baby.
8. Johnny and Maxie continue to argue about Lulu, and Maxie accuses Lulu of being too fragile for Johnny.
9. Spinelli rambles about Jason's destiny and the inevitability of Sonny's return to the business.
10. Kate and Sonny discuss getting a prenup, and Kate insists that it's necessary in case the government comes after Sonny's assets.

Maxie is overjoyed to see Robin, who has recently returned from the dead, and they discuss Maxie's daughter and Spinelli's potential move to Portland with his girlfriend Ellie. Meanwhile, Dante suggests to Lulu that they try to have another baby to help them heal from the loss of their daughter.

Carly is unable to come home for Christmas and asks Courtney to spend the holiday with her sons; Sonny is unhappy about Courtney bringing Nikolas to his house for Christmas, leading to tension between the two. Alexis is appointed to defend Manny Ruiz and struggles to balance her work and family obligations.

Johnny and Claudia discuss Claudia's upcoming marriage to Sonny Corinthos, which Johnny opposes. Claudia plans to go through with the marriage to strengthen Johnny's position in the organization and ensure that he will have a powerful empire to run when he takes over. Jason and Spinelli discuss the Russian mob, who are after Sam. Jason tells Spinelli that he needs ammo, and Spinelli offers to get some. Carly tries to stop Jax from buying Spoon Island and building a resort on it, but Jax refuses to back down.
